0.title: Pujara smashes 22 runs off 1 over, slams hundred off 73 deliveries in one-day match
0.article_body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara smashed 22 runs off one over while playing for Sussex against Warwickshire in a Royal London One-Day Cup match and reached his hundred off 73 deliveries in the match. Pujara slammed three fours, two doubles and a six off Warwickshire pacer Liam Norwell in the 45th over. Pujara scored 107 runs off 79 deliveries.

1.title: YouTube working to launch streaming video services: Report
1.article_body: YouTube is planning to launch an online store for streaming video services, The Wall Street Journal reported on Friday. The report mentioned that the company has been working on the same for about 18 months now and has renewed talks with entertainment companies for participation. This will let YouTube join companies such as Roku and Apple in the streaming market.

2.title: Flying umbrella pierces woman's chest at US beach; police say 'Winds threw it into her'
2.article_body: A woman was killed after a flying beach umbrella pierced her chest in South Carolina, authorities said. The umbrella was blown from its anchoring by the wind, with police saying it was "thrown into the victim". The US Consumer Product Safety Commission estimates about 3,000 people are injured by beach umbrellas every year.

3.title: 1 dead, 9 injured as lightning strikes zinc plant in Rajasthan
3.article_body: One man was burnt to death and nine others were seriously injured after an acid tank exploded due to lightning at Hindustan Zinc plant in Rajasthan on Friday. The incident occurred in Chittorgarh district following which ten employees suffered burn injuries. They were rushed to district hospital where one of them died during treatment, Additional SP Kailash Singh Sandhu said.

4.title: BJP won 140 out of 186 seats in Goa Panchayat elections: CM Sawant
4.article_body: BJP has won over 140 seats out of 186 seats in the Goa Panchayat elections, state CM Pramod Sawant said on Friday. The state BJP President Sadanand Shet Tanavade told ANI that this is the "first time" in Goa Panchayat elections that "any party has won so many seats". Goa had reported a 78.7% voter turnout in the Panchayat elections.

5.title: Utterly horrified: Tharoor after author Salman Rushdie stabbed on stage in US
5.article_body: After India-born author Salman Rushdie was stabbed multiple times on stage in New York, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted that he's "utterly horrified and shocked" by the incident. "With a sinking heart, I recognize that life for him can never be the same again. A sad day, worse if creative expression can no longer be free & open," Tharoor wrote.

6.title: People walked out of my debut film 'Josh', it 'scarred' me: Naga
6.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who features in Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said people "walked" out of his debut film 'Josh' which hit him "hard", adding that it "scarred" him. "A lot of people go for the first day. I can't because I am a wreck. I have severe anxiety problems on the day the film is releasing," added Naga.

7.title: 6 more bodies recovered after boat capsizes in UP's Banda; death toll reaches 9
7.article_body: At least six more bodies have been recovered from Kishanpur ghat in Uttar Pradesh's Banda after a boat capsized in the Yamuna on Thursday. A total of nine bodies have been recovered so far. The boat capsized due to strong winds, the Superintendent of Police said. CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday announced ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for families of those killed.

8.title: India reports 15,815 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,19,264
8.article_body: India has reported 15,815 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,561 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,19,264, while the death toll has risen to 5,26,996, according to the latest data.

9.title: Mangaluru school asks students to remove 'rakhis'; apologises after protests
9.article_body: A Christian missionary school in Karnataka's Mangaluru allegedly asked its students to remove 'rakhis' claiming that 'jewellery' was not allowed in the school. It later issued an apology following protests by the parents of at least 20 students. "We uphold the values of all religions. The incident was a mistake by some of our staff members," the school's in-charge said.

10.title: Ratan Tata receives Tricolour under 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign; govt shares pic
10.article_body: Tata Group Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata was presented with the National Flag ahead of the Independence Day under 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The government also shared a picture of the flag being presented to the industrialist. Under the campaign, people have been urged to hoist or display the National Flag at their homes between August 13 and 15.

11.title: Paraguay Vice Prez Velazquez to resign after US sanctions
11.article_body: Paraguayan Vice President Hugo Velazquez on Friday said he would resign next week and withdraw his candidacy for the presidency after he was sanctioned by the US for "significant corruption". Velazquez denied the US allegations and insisted he has "a clear conscience". Velazquez, who is barred from entering the US, said his resignation would be offered to "protect" his party.

12.title: Who are the Ballon d'Or nominees as Messi not included for 1st time since 2005?
12.article_body: Seven-time Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi hasn't been nominated for Ballon d'Or 2022. It's the first time since 2005 that Messi has not made it to the 30-man shortlist for the award. Meanwhile, Cristiano Ronaldo is on the Ballon d'Or shortlist for the 18th year in a row. Other nominees include Robert Lewandowski, Kylian Mbappé and Erling Haaland, among others.

13.title: I only want to work for people like him: Employee fired by CEO who posted crying selfie
13.article_body: After HyperSocial's CEO Braden Wallake's crying selfie went viral, an employee who was laid off by him said he's only interested in working for people like Wallake. Noah Smith was told that the company didn't have funds to continue employing him. "I was a bit shocked, but didn't feel any immediate rush of anger or resentment," Smith wrote on LinkedIn.

14.title: India's industrial output grows 12.3% in June: Govt data
14.article_body: India’s industrial output, measured through the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a 12.3% growth in June, data released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation showed on Friday. The manufacturing and electricity sectors led the growth. IIP growth in June 2021 was 13.8%. The industrial growth in the April-June period of the current fiscal rose by 12.7%.

15.title: Businessman's ₹193-cr superyacht with 5 rooms, pool bursts into flames in Spain
15.article_body: A superyacht worth around £20 million (₹193 crore) belonging to Italian businessman Paolo Scudieri went up in flames near Formentera island in Spain. All five bedrooms, gym and swimming pool in the yacht named Aria SF are said to be destroyed after the fire. Emergency services said nine passengers and seven crew were rescued from the Aria SF.

16.title: Arsenal's Granit Xhaka picks winning Champions League over World Cup
16.article_body: Arsenal midfielder and Switzerland captain Granit Xhaka picked winning the Champions League over winning the World Cup during an interview. Xhaka further chose to finish in the top four of the Premier League, which ensures Champions League qualification in comparison to winning the FA Cup. Xhaka named Cristiano Ronaldo when asked to choose between Ronaldo and Lionel Messi.

17.title: I was very frustrated: Fàbregas on throwing pizza at Sir Alex in 2004
17.article_body: Recollecting Arsenal's 0-2 defeat against Manchester United in October 2004, which ended his team's 49-game unbeaten run, ex-Arsenal midfielder Cesc Fàbregas said, "I was very frustrated." "We started hearing noises...I didn't have the...courage maybe to go into that fight. They were monsters in there...I threw a slice of pizza and...it hit [United manager] Sir Alex Ferguson," he added.

18.title: 72-year-old man jumps in front of metro train in Gurugram, dies
18.article_body: A 72-year-old man died after he jumped in front of an approaching train at the Guru Dronacharya Metro Station in Gurugram on Friday, police said. The police added that a suicide note was found in the deceased's pocket. "The man didn't blame anyone in...suicide note for his extreme step," a station house officer said. The incident occurred at 4.56 pm.

19.title: Bajaj Group gives 5 lakh National Flags to PMC for free distribution
19.article_body: Bajaj Group has handed over five lakh National Flags to the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) for free distribution. This comes as the civic body decided to distribute flags for free to every household in the city to ensure flag hoisting under the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' initiative. "Bajaj family is a family of freedom fighters," Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said.

20.title: Top secret files found at Trump's home; ex-US Prez suspected of violating Espionage Act
20.article_body: The FBI seized top secret files in a search of former US President Donald Trump's estate in Florida this week, according to a search warrant. The warrant indicates that FBI agents were looking into potential violations of the Espionage Act, which makes it illegal to keep or transmit potentially dangerous national security information. Agents removed 11 sets of documents.

21.title: 6,000 posts of Anganwadi workers will be filled in 45 days: Punjab CM Mann
21.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said that 6,000 posts of Anganwadi workers will be filled in 45 days. The entire recruitment will be merit-based and no bribe and recommendation will work, he added. As many as 4,300 Punjab Police posts are being filled and appointment letters would be given to those selected in the coming days, Mann stated.

22.title: British PM, French Prez condemn 'cowardly' attack on Salman Rushdie
22.article_body: Following an attack on India-born author Salman Rushdie in New York, French President Emmanuel Macron said, "For 33 years...Rushdie has embodied freedom and the fight against obscurantism. He has just been the victim of a cowardly attack by the forces of hatred and barbarism...We stand by his side." UK PM Boris Johnson said he was "appalled" by the attack.

23.title: 'Laal...' isn't Aamir's biopic: Mona on criticism over playing his mother
23.article_body: Reacting to criticism over playing Aamir Khan's mother in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' at the age of 40 with Aamir 57 years old, actress Mona Singh said, "It is not...Aamir's...biopic...That would be wrong." "I was so confident...that most people won't question the age gap after seeing the film," added Mona. "What's the logic...This is wrong," Aamir had responded to the criticism.

24.title: Karnataka reports 2,032 new COVID-19 cases, 1,202 from B'luru alone
24.article_body: Karnataka reported 2,032 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Friday, out of which 1,202 cases were recorded in Bengaluru alone. According to data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath, no deaths were reported in the city on Friday. With 7,102 active COVID-19 cases, the test positivity rate in Bengaluru now stands at 6.94%, data showed.

25.title: I am a Chinese, not a terrorist: Huawei India CEO reportedly tells Delhi court
25.article_body: Huawei India's CEO Li Xiongwei told a Delhi court, "I am a Chinese (national) and not a terrorist," in response to the Income Tax Department's opposition to his bail plea, the ET reported. India doesn't have an extradition treaty with China and if Xiongwei leaves, it would be tough to bring him back for trial, the Department told the court.

26.title: 2 persons from Mumbai held in Pune with mephedrone worth ₹7.56 lakh
26.article_body: The Anti-Narcotics Cell of Pune City Police's crime branch arrested two residents of Mumbai with 54 grams of mephedrone (MD) worth ₹7.56 lakh near Khadi Machine Chowk in Kondhwa. Police acted on a tip-off and laid a trap to arrest the suspected drug peddlers. After the operation, police also recovered cell phones and some cash from the accused.

27.title: Drunk air hostess, friends create ruckus at restaurant, break car's windshield in Jaipur
27.article_body: A drunk air hostess and her three friends allegedly created a ruckus at a Jaipur restaurant after getting into an argument with a family, police said. She also allegedly broke the windshield of the car belonging to the family with a beer bottle. Police said the air hostess and five others were arrested in connection with the case.

28.title: India-China relationship can't be normal as border situation is not normal: Govt
28.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday said, "We have maintained our position that if China disturbs the peace and tranquillity in border areas, it will impact our relations." "Our relationship is not normal, it cannot be normal as the border situation is not normal," he further said.

29.title: Hyd Traffic Police issues advisory ahead of tricoloured balloons programme
29.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police has issued an advisory ahead of the release of tricoloured balloons at Upper Tankbund on Saturday. According to the advisory, from 9:30 am to 12:30 pm, traffic from Liberty towards Upper Tankbund will be diverted at Ambedkar statue towards Telugu Thalli, Iqbal Minar. Parking places have also been notified in the advisory.

30.title: 34-yr-old dies as throat slit by kite string while riding bike in Delhi
30.article_body: A 34-year-old man died after his throat was slit by glass-coated kite string ('manjha') in Delhi's Shastri Park area on Friday, police said. The man was with his wife and their eight-year-old daughter when the accident happened, police added. "The driver of an ambulance which was passing by stopped and took the family to the hospital," the deceased's nephew said.

31.title: 53-year-old Anne Heche declared legally dead days after car crash, family confirms
31.article_body: Actress Anne Heche, who had been in a coma since a car crash in Los Angeles last week, has been declared legally dead, her family confirmed. Her representative said that she is legally dead according to California law, but she is still on life support as medical professionals are assessing if any of her organs can be donated.

32.title: Bear possibly hallucinating after being high on 'mad honey' rescued in Turkey
32.article_body: A bear cub believed to be high on 'mad honey' and possibly hallucinating was rescued in Turkey after being found in a forest. The disoriented bear was captured on camera wobbling and whining in the back of a pickup truck after being rescued. Mad honey is a type of rhododendron honey that can have hallucinogenic effects.

33.title: 24-yr-old who attacked Salman Rushdie onstage in NY identified as Hadi Matar
33.article_body: A 24-year-old man named Hadi Matar has been taken into custody after he stabbed 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie onstage in New York. Matar, who is from New Jersey, stabbed Rushdie at least once in the neck and the stomach, Major Eugene Staniszewski of New York State Police said. A motive for Matar's alleged attack hasn't been determined yet.

34.title: Author Salman Rushdie on ventilator, could lose eye after being stabbed: Agent
34.article_body: 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie is on ventilator after he was stabbed in the abdomen and the neck onstage in New York. "The news is not good...Salman will likely lose one eye; the nerves in his arm were severed; and his liver was stabbed and damaged," Rushdie's agent said. The interviewer onstage was also attacked and suffered facial injury.

35.title: Students understood JNU not for anti-national activities: Chancellor
35.article_body: JNU students have realised that it is not a place for activities that are anti-national or against the interest of the nation's sovereignty, said chancellor VK Saraswat. "At times, there was a clash of ideologies, that is why you used to hear that there are problems," he added. Violent clashes have broken out inside the campus in recent years.

36.title: Advocate who beat constable in Anand Vihar police station gets bail
36.article_body: An advocate who allegedly beat up a police constable has been granted bail by a Delhi court on Friday. The court said there was no need for custodial interrogation and added that the accused had belittled the institution of the bar. The Head Constable was allegedly beaten by a group of people inside Anand Vihar police station on July 31.

37.title: There was a pool of blood around Rushdie, people were saying 'He has a pulse': Eyewitness
37.article_body: Rita Landman, an endocrinologist who was in audience when author Salman Rushdie was attacked on a stage in New York, said there was a pool of blood around him. Landman, who walked on stage to offer assistance, added he appeared to be alive and wasn't receiving CPR. "People were saying, 'He has a pulse, he has a pulse'," she stated.

38.title: LinkedIn user's post on specially-abled B'luru Swiggy delivery man goes viral
38.article_body: In a now-viral LinkedIn post, a Bengaluru resident shared a picture of a specially-abled Swiggy delivery man. Rohit Kumar said he had got impatient over his delayed order but felt "stupid" when the delivery man arrived. "[He was] graciously smiling at me...[and] trying to balance himself with crutches...I [felt] stupid [for getting] impatient sitting on my comfortable bed," Rohit said.

39.title: Asia Cup game against India just like any other match: Babar Azam
39.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has said that they would approach their first game of the Asia Cup 2022 against India as any other match. He said the team will play the tournament by focusing on their game and believing in their abilities. "Putting our best effort is in our hands, but results are not," said the top-order batsman.

40.title: Ridiculous: BJP on rumours about replacing Karnataka CM Bommai
40.article_body: BJP National General Secretary in charge of Karnataka Arun Singh on Friday said speculation on replacing Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai was "ridiculous", saying "these are tricks of Congress". He asserted that BJP will contest the 2023 Karnataka assembly polls under Bommai's leadership. He said Congress was trying to create confusion as there was infighting among Congress members.

41.title: UK officially declares drought in large parts of England
41.article_body: Large parts of England were officially declared drought-hit on Friday, amid prolonged heatwave conditions in the country. The affected regions include all of east England and parts of south and central England. "We are currently experiencing a second heatwave after what was the driest July on record for parts of the country," said UK Water Minister Steve Double.

42.title: Timely slap to BJP: Tejashwi on Nitish Kumar quitting NDA alliance
42.article_body: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav said JDU chief Nitish Kumar's decision to break away from the NDA alliance was "a timely slap to BJP". Yadav was speaking to the media after stepping out from meeting Congress President Sonia Gandhi in Delhi. The new RJD-JDU alliance is set to undergo a floor test to prove its majority on August 24.

43.title: First Africa-bound UN grain ship arrives in Ukraine since invasion
43.article_body: The first Africa-bound United Nations-chartered grain ship since Russia's invasion of Ukraine docked in Pivdennyi port on Friday, Ukrainian Infrastructure Minister Oleksandr Kubrakov said on Friday. The ship was hired to carry Ukrainian grain to famine-stricken parts of the Horn of Africa, where 18 million people face severe hunger. The war had halted grain exports from Ukraine.

44.title: Kerala MLA KT Jaleel calls PoK 'Azad Kashmir', BJP criticises him
44.article_body: CPI(M)-backed independent Kerala MLA KT Jaleel called Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) "Azad Kashmir" in a Facebook post, after his visit to Srinagar. He also criticised the Centre's decision to abrogate Article 370 and said, "The special status was taken away without their consent". The BJP has reacted by calling Jaleel "anti-India" and asked for him to be booked for sedition.

45.title: Delhi reports 10 deaths due to COVID-19, logs 2,136 fresh cases
45.article_body: Delhi recorded 10 fatalities due to COVID-19 on Friday, the highest in six months, as per data released by the health department. According to the data, the national capital also logged 2,136 fresh cases of the infection with a positivity rate of 15.02%. On Thursday, Delhi had reported 2,726 cases, the highest single-day spike in daily caseload in six-and-a-half months.

46.title: Will lead to a revolution: Harsha Bhogle on window for women's IPL
46.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle has said that a dedicated window in the sporting calendar for women's IPL will "lead to a revolution" in the women's game in India. This comes as reports claimed that the BCCI is likely to schedule a women's IPL in March 2023. BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said the event would be a "priority" for them.

47.title: NIA arrests 10th accused in Umesh Kolhe murder case
47.article_body: The NIA on Friday arrested 28-year-old Shaikh Shakeel for his alleged involvement in the murder of pharmacist Umesh Kolhe in Maharashtra's Amravati. During investigation, Shakeel's "active role" in the murder conspiracy came to light, the agency said. Shakeel is the tenth accused to be arrested in the case. Kolhe was allegedly murdered for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

48.title: ED attaches assets worth over ₹300 crore of Bengaluru's Mantri Developers
48.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has attached immovable assets worth over ₹300 crore as part of its ongoing money laundering probe against Bengaluru-based real estate group Mantri Developers. The private firm is alleged to have cheated several home buyers, officials said. Notably, the home buyers' money was given to the developers but had been allegedly "diverted" for non-construction activities.

49.title: Man from minority Ahmadi community stabbed to death in Pakistan
49.article_body: A 62-year-old man belonging to Pakistan's minority Ahmadi community was stabbed to death in Rabwah town on Friday allegedly for refusing to chant Islamist slogans. "The accused approached Naseer Ahmad...and asked him to raise slogans of an Islamist party," a spokesman for the minority group said. "On Ahmad's refusal, he repeatedly stabbed and killed him on spot," the spokesman added.

50.title: VVS Laxman to be India's acting head coach for Zimbabwe ODI series
50.article_body: Former cricketer VVS Laxman will be the acting head coach of the Indian team for the next week's ODI series in Zimbabwe. "Yes, Laxman will be in charge...It's not like Rahul Dravid is taking a break," BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said. He added, "[But Dravid is absent because] there is little gap between the Asia Cup and Zimbabwe series."

51.title: Kejriwal a 'lie minister', creating fear among masses: Anurag Thakur
51.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Friday accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of "creating fear" among the masses regarding Centre's finances and called him a "lie minister". Kejriwal has alleged that the BJP-led Centre lacks funds to support social welfare schemes as it has waived loans and taxes worth crores of rupees of its "super-rich friends".

52.title: Pavan Varma quits Trinamool Congress months after joining it
52.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP Pavan Varma quit Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Friday, months after joining the party. Varma had joined TMC after being sacked from JD(U) due to his stand on Citizenship Amendment Act. His resignation comes after JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar broke ties with BJP and joined hands with Rashtriya Janata Dal to form the Mahagathbandhan government in Bihar.

53.title: India's relationship with China is not normal: S Jaishankar
53.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said that the relationship between India and China "cannot be normal as the border situation is not normal". While speaking at an event, the minister said that if China disturbed the peace in border areas, it would impact relations. He added that the Indian military has been holding its ground at the border.

54.title: EU proposal on nuclear deal acceptable if assurances provided: Iran
54.article_body: EU's proposal for revival of the 2015 nuclear deal can be acceptable if it provides Iran with "assurance on...safeguards, sanctions and guarantees," Iranian state media reported citing a senior diplomat on Friday. The EU on Monday said it had submitted its "final text" for revival of the pact as indirect talks between Iran and the US regarding the issue concluded.

55.title: Raju Srivastava's family issues statement, says 'his condition is stable'
55.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava's family has issued a statement saying his condition is stable. "We are praying for his speedy recovery. The doctors are treating him and are doing their best...Please ignore any rumours/ fake news being circulated," the statement read. The comedian was admitted to Delhi's AIIMS after he suffered a heart attack on Wednesday.

56.title: Liverpool's Joel Matip injured ahead of Palace clash: Report
56.article_body: Liverpool defender Joel Matip reportedly sat out Friday's training session due to a groin problem. With the club's first-choice central defender Ibrahima Konate injured, Matip played in the opening match of the Premier League 2022-23 against Fulham. The reported injury may affect Matip's availability for the match against Crystal Palace on August 15.

57.title: Raju Srivastava moved his fingers & shoulders, your prayers are working: Suman
57.article_body: Sharing a health update about comedian Raju Srivastava who was hospitalised following a heart attack, Shekhar Suman tweeted, "Good news, Raju moved his fingers and shoulders." "Things looking slightly positive according to the doctors. Your prayers are working," he added. Earlier in the day, Shekhar tweeted, "Raju hasn't regained consciousness in...last 46 hours...pray hard for his recovery."

58.title: Videos by neighbour compared me to Babar, Aurangzeb: Salman in defamation trial
58.article_body: In the defamation case filed by actor Salman Khan against his neighbour Ketan Kakkad and others, Salman said that the videos uploaded by Kakkad, "communally provoked the viewers against" him. Kakkad compared Salman to Babar and Aurangzeb in a video and said he was "trying to shut down a Ganesh temple", the actor's counsel told the Bombay High Court.

59.title: No Indian player can play or mentor any team in overseas T20 leagues: BCCI
59.article_body: With several IPL franchises buying teams in foreign T20 leagues, the BCCI said that no Indian player can take part in any other league until he is retired from all forms of the game. "If any player wants to take part in these upcoming leagues he can only do so when he cuts off all ties with...BCCI," the BCCI stated.

60.title: Author Salman Rushdie, who was stabbed on stage, is alive: NY Governor
60.article_body: Author Salman Rushdie, who was stabbed on stage as he was about to give a lecture, is alive and has been airlifted to safety, said New York Governor Kathy Hochul. The author is getting the care he needs at a local hospital, she added. The incident took place at Chautauqua Institution in New York.

61.title: Will work harder, score more runs: Ishan on missing out from Asia Cup squad
61.article_body: After not being named in the Indian squad for the upcoming Asia Cup tournament, wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan said that he will "work harder and score more runs". "I feel that what selectors do is fair. They put a lot of thought while selecting players," Kishan said. Notably, the 24-year-old cricketer is India's second highest run-scorer in T20Is this year.

62.title: 9 yrs on, we have a very strong bond: Dhawan on friendship with Rohit
62.article_body: Indian batter Shikhar Dhawan has said that he shares a "very strong bond and friendship" with skipper Rohit Sharma. "Nine years on...we've come to understand each other's game...we are always looking to support each other," Dhawan said. He added, "Rohit has been a fantastic opening partner and to have a milestone that I share with Rohit is a happy feeling."

63.title: Gang violence in Mexico's Ciudad Juárez leaves 11 dead
63.article_body: Mexican security officials on Friday said a gang riot inside a border prison that left two inmates dead quickly spread to the streets of Ciudad Juárez where alleged gang members killed nine more people. "They attacked the civilian, innocent population like a sort of revenge," Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said. About 20 others were injured in the violence.

64.title: Aamir faces complaint for allegedly disrespecting Indian Army in Laal Singh Chaddha
64.article_body: A complaint has been filed against Aamir Khan and 'Laal Singh Chaddha' for allegedly disrespecting the Indian Army and hurting Hindu sentiments. A Delhi-based lawyer, in his complaint, stated, "The makers have depicted that a mentally challenged person was allowed to join Army." He also alleged that a scene in the movie caused "enraged emotions among the Hindu religion followers".

65.title: World javelin champion Peters beaten up on boat, thrown into water; video surfaces
65.article_body: Grenadian javelin thrower Anderson Peters, who recently won gold in World Athletics Championships, was beaten up and thrown off a boat in his native country. A video has surfaced online showing a group of men beating him on the boat called 'Harbour Master'. Peters was later thrown into the water. He reportedly suffered minor injuries in the incident.

66.title: Free entry to Taj Mahal premises from August 13-15: ASI
66.article_body: Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) announced on Friday that entry to the premises of Taj Mahal will remain free and accessible for all visitors from August 13-15. However, the main mausoleum has been exempted from this provision in order to effectively manage the visitors, ASI added. Earlier, Union Culture Ministry announced free entry to all ASI-protected monuments from August 5-15.

67.title: Fan asks why shooter Abhinav Bindra retired too early, Bindra responds
67.article_body: Reacting to a Twitter post about the 14th anniversary of shooter Abhinav Bindra's Olympic gold medal-winning moment, a fan asked why he retired too early. Bindra responded, "1) Recognised my fading skills 2) Failed in two successive [Olympic] Games 3) Was...appropriate time to give my spot to...younger athlete and talent! (did not just want to hold on to it)."

68.title: China and Nepal agree to build trans-Himalayan rail network
68.article_body: The Chinese Foreign Ministry said that China and Nepal have agreed to build the so-called Trans-Himalayan Multi-Dimensional Connectivity Network under China's Belt and Road Initiative. China would finance the feasibility study of a cross-border railway and send experts to Nepal to conduct surveys this year, it added. The network will involve the building of railways and communication networks.

69.title: Akshay is family, started tying rakhi to him almost 30 yrs ago: Rupali
69.article_body: Rupali Ganguly, in an episode of 'Ravivaar with Star Parivaar', spoke about her bond with Akshay Kumar and said, "Akshay is family to us." She revealed she started tying rakhi to him almost 30 years ago. Rupali further said Akshay became very close to her because of her father, who had given film to the actor in his early days.

70.title: Red Bull F1 boss says he looks up to Alex Ferguson in dealing with criticism
70.article_body: Red Bull F1 chief Christian Horner has said that he looks up to former Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson when he has to deal with criticism. "I doubt he ever worried about what perception other managers or people thought about him," said Horner about the now-retired manager. He was responding to questions about his aggressive style and nature of management.

71.title: School bus falls off road in Himachal Pradesh; 12 students injured
71.article_body: As many as 12 students of SSRVM Senior Secondary School were injured after their bus fell 20-30 m from the road. The incident took place near Lamlehri Upperli bend in Una. All the students on the bus were rescued and taken to a regional hospital in Una. The condition of three of the injured students is serious, an official said.

72.title: Boy barred from giving Guj class 12 board exams for bribing examiner
72.article_body: A class 12 student has been debarred from giving the Gujarat board examinations for a year, as he allegedly tried to bribe an examiner, an official said on Friday. The science stream student is accused of attaching a ₹500 note to his answer sheet in this year's examinations. The boy is among 22 science stream students who faced disciplinary action.

73.title: 24 Pakistani refugees get Indian citizenship in Gujarat's Rajkot
73.article_body: At least 24 refugees, mostly Hindus, from Pakistan were granted Indian citizenship by authorities in Gujarat's Rajkot on Friday, an official said. Gujarat Minister of State for Home Harsh Sanghavi handed over citizenship certificates to them, an official release stated. "My family has been waiting for...16 years to get Indian citizenship," a youngster pursuing career in aviation sector said.

74.title: Glad TN got 5th elephant reserve in Tirunelveli's Agathiyamalai: Stalin
74.article_body: On World Elephant Day, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said he was glad the state got its fifth elephant reserve at Tirunelveli's Agathiyamalai. "Elephants play a critical role in balancing...forest ecosystems," he tweeted. This comes after the Union Environment Ministry made an announcement accepting a proposal of the state forest department to notify the land as an elephant reserve.

75.title: Karnataka Cabinet passes aerospace and defence policy
75.article_body: The Karnataka Cabinet on Friday passed the 'Karnataka Aerospace and Defence Policy 2022-27' which aims to attract ₹45,000 crore investment. It offers incentives to manufacturing units and companies in the sector. "The aim is to make Karnataka a hub in aerospace and defence sectors. We want to strengthen the state's position...and encourage exports," Minister JC Madhuswamy said.

76.title: In touch with family: MEA after Indian-origin woman's suicide in US
76.article_body: Days after Indian-origin woman Mandeep Kaur died by suicide in US allegedly over domestic abuse, India's External Affairs Ministry on Friday informed that the Indian Consulate in New York is in touch with the family and local authorities. "Our embassy in Washington is in contact with the US authorities, who assured us of appropriate action," MEA Spokesperson said.

77.title: Terrible day for literature: Dalrymple on attack on Salman Rushdie
77.article_body: Following an attack on India-born author Salman Rushdie in the US on Friday, historian William Dalrymple tweeted, "A terrible day for literature, for freedom of speech and for authors everywhere." "Poor poor Salman: I pray he's not hurt and recovers quickly," he added. Rushdie, who wrote 'The Satanic Verses', was attacked as he was about to give a lecture.

78.title: Andhra govt bans 'derogatory and abusive' slang for Nayee Brahmins
78.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh government has banned the use of a few words in the local slang that are derogatory to the Nayee Brahmin community. "Any person using such abusive and prohibited words...shall be liable for action under the...Indian Penal Code," the order said. The new rule was brought in based on recommendations of the Backward Classes Welfare Department.

79.title: Boris Johnson has not returned my calls: Rishi Sunak
79.article_body: Britain's prime ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak said Prime Minister Boris Johnson has not returned his calls since he resigned from the UK Cabinet as Chancellor last month. Speaking to 'The Daily Telegraph', Sunak said, "I have messaged and called but, unsurprisingly, he hasn't returned my calls." Sunak and Foreign Secretary Liz Truss are contesting to become Britain's next Prime Minister.

80.title: 5 Chinese state-owned companies to delist from New York Stock Exchange amid US tensions
80.article_body: Five Chinese state-owned companies would delist from the New York Stock Exchange amid economic and diplomatic tensions with the United States. They include China Life Insurance, PetroChina, China Petroleum & Chemical, Aluminum Corporation of China Limited and Sinopec Shanghai Petrochemical. The five companies were flagged by the US securities regulator as failing to meet its auditing standards.

81.title: Kareena wishes Sara Ali Khan on her b'day, shares throwback pic
81.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan took to her Instagram Stories on Friday to wish Sara Ali Khan on her birthday. Sharing a childhood picture of Sara with Saif Ali Khan, she wrote, "Happy Birthday darling Sara. Unlimited pizza and cakes for you today." Sara is the daughter of Saif from his first wife, Amrita Singh. Sara turned 27 on Friday.

82.title: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi Yadav gets Z+ security cover, bulletproof car
82.article_body: The Bihar government on Friday granted Z+ security cover and a bulletproof car to Tejashwi Yadav, who took oath as the new Deputy Chief Minister of the state. According to an official, a circular to this effect was issued on Thursday and commandos of the Bihar Special Armed Police (BSAP) would be involved in the security of the RJD leader.

83.title: Rushdie suffered apparent stab wound to neck, his condition not known yet: NY Police
83.article_body: New York State Police have issued a statement in regard to the attack on author Salman Rushdie. "On August 12...at about 11 am, a male suspect ran up onto the stage and attacked Rushdie," the statement read. "Rushdie suffered an apparent stab wound to the neck, and was transported by helicopter to...[a]...hospital. His condition is not yet known," it added.

84.title: Police stop 'Har Ghar Tiranga' bike rally led by BJP leader in Bengal
84.article_body: Police stopped a 'Har Ghar Tiranga' bike rally led by BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari in West Bengal's Nandigram on Friday. They said the leader only had permission for 'padyatra', not bike journey. "A procession to campaign for hoisting the Indian National Flag is being prohibited...Does the [West Bengal] Administration feel that the state isn't a part of India?" Adhikari tweeted.

85.title: Over 2,500 houses destroyed in Sudan floods
85.article_body: Seasonal rains and floods have destroyed over 2,500 houses in east Sudan, leaving thousands homeless in what is an already impoverished region. The nationwide death toll from the rains is still undetermined. Since the monsoon season began in May, about 38,000 people have been affected by floods in Sudan, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs said.

86.title: ED freezes assets worth ₹370 crore of crypto exchange Vauld's India entity
86.article_body: The ED has frozen assets worth ₹370 crore of Flipvolt Technologies, the Indian entity of crypto exchange Vauld, in a money laundering case. "Lax KYC norms, loose regulatory control of allowing transfers to foreign wallets without asking any reason, non-recording of transactions on blockchains to save costs...has ensured...Flipvolt isn't able to give any account for missing crypto assets," ED said.

87.title: I love my boys but I wanted a daughter: Shefali Shah
87.article_body: Shefali Shah, who shares two sons with her filmmaker-husband Vipul Amrutlal Shah, said she wanted to have a daughter in both of her pregnancies. "I wanted a daughter. I love my boys, but I wanted a daughter, both...times," she said. Shefali was most recently seen in 'Darlings', in which she played a mother to Badrunissa Sheikh, played by Alia Bhatt.

88.title: This year's last Supermoon seen in skies across the world, pics surface
88.article_body: This year's third and last Supermoon has been spotted in night skies across the world, with pictures of the natural phenomenon being shared online. Referred to as the Sturgeon Moon, the Supermoon reached its zenith in the early hours of Friday morning. It appeared bigger than normal with orange hues.

89.title: Russian officials trained in Iran as part of drone deal: US
89.article_body: Russian officials received training in Iran over recent weeks as part of the agreement for transfer of drones from Iran to Russia, the US State Department said on Thursday. Last month, Washington said it had information that suggested Iran was preparing to provide Russia with up to a several hundred drones, including some "weapons-capable" ones, amid the Russia-Ukraine war.

90.title: China sanctions Lithuanian deputy minister over her Taiwan visit
90.article_body: China on Friday said that it has sanctioned Lithuania's Deputy Transport and Communications Minister, Agne Vaiciukeviciute, over her visit to Taiwan. China's foreign ministry said that all engagements between Beijing and Vaiciukeviciute's ministry would also be suspended. Lithuania's Ministry of Transport and Communications said it had not received any official information regarding the matter.

91.title: Fossil of small armour-plated dinosaur discovered in Argentina
91.article_body: The remains of a small armoured dinosaur that lived about 100 million years ago were discovered in Argentina. It likely walked upright on its back legs and weighed as much as a pet cat. Named Jakapil kaniukura, the dinosaur would have been well-protected with rows of bony disk-shaped armour along its neck and back, down to its tail, researchers said.

92.title: When will we discuss loan waivers to big corporations?: Congress
92.article_body: Congress on Friday asked when there will be a discussion on loan waivers to big corporations. "When will there be a discussion on freebies given by the public sector banks of ₹5.8 lakh crore in the last five years?" Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh asked. These comments come in the wake of PM Narendra Modi's criticism of the culture of 'freebies'.

93.title: Shah Rukh Khan's reported look from 'Brahmāstra' leaked online, pics go viral
93.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's pictures, reportedly from 'Brahmāstra', were leaked online. The actor's first look as Vanarastra, inspired by Lord Hanuman, has gone viral on the internet. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "I am getting goosebumps already" while another comment read, "This leaked footage is gold." "SRK’s presence...will make #Brahmāstra an even more exciting affair!" another Twitter user wrote.

94.title: Rare microscopic creatures discovered in Scottish caves
94.article_body: Researchers have discovered rare microscopic creatures, the tiny crustaceans named ostracods, in the Smoo Cave in Sutherland and Allt nan Uamh Stream Cave in Assynt. The creatures found are around one millimetre in size and were found residing in pools inside the caves. "Styglobitic creatures live entirely below the earth's surface," a researcher said.

95.title: RCB's official YouTube channel hacked, name changed to 'MicroStrategy'
95.article_body: The official YouTube channel of Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) was hacked, with hackers changing the name of the channel to 'MicroStrategy'. The hackers also posted a video with thumbnail reading, "Event Now...Hurry Up!" The channel was later removed, with "This account has been terminated for violating YouTube's Community Guidelines" message being displayed on opening the channel.

96.title: Minister TS Singhdeo's relative found dead near Bilaspur railway track
96.article_body: Chhattisgarh minister and Congress leader TS Singhdeo's relative Bir Bhadra Pratap was found dead near a railway track in Bilaspur's Belghana, police said on Friday. Bir Bhadra, who was popularly known as Sachin Singh, died after allegedly falling from a train, ANI reported. Chhattisgarh Police said post-mortem examination has been done.

97.title: Around 250 people executed in Iran this year
97.article_body: Iran executed around 250 people since the beginning of this year, human rights organisation Amnesty International said in a recent report. The number of executions this year is twice as many as the same period last year in Iran, the report added. In 2021, Iran is estimated to have executed 314 people, the second-highest rate of executions per capita.

98.title: Suryakumar Yadav buys Mercedes Benz GLS worth around ₹2 crore, pic surfaces
98.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav bought a Mercedes Benz GLS worth around ₹2 crore ahead of Asia Cup 2022, which will begin in the UAE later this month. Earlier this year, Suryakumar had bought a Nissan 1 Ton Jonga. Suryakumar made his Team India debut in 2021 and has played 13 ODIs and 23 T20Is so far.

99.title: Jadeja has to prove his batting to replace Karthik, Pandya: Manjrekar
99.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has commented on all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's position in the India T20I team. "If Jadeja is going to be a batting all-rounder, then he has got to show that he is an adequate replacement to...Dinesh Karthik, who is likely to bat at number 6-7, or...Hardik Pandya," Manjrekar said.

100.title: Terrorists open fire at checkpoint in Kashmir, policeman injured
100.article_body: Terrorists opened fire at a security checkpoint in Anantnag, resulting in injuries to a Jammu and Kashmir policeman. The police have cordoned off the area and a search is underway for the attackers. The injured policeman, Ghulam Qadir, was immediately evacuated and is currently receiving treatment in a hospital, the Kashmir Police said in a tweet.

101.title: Valour of soldiers to be included in school textbooks: Education Minister
101.article_body: Tales of valour of Indian soldiers would soon be made part of the school textbooks, Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan, said. "To strengthen the sense of responsibility towards the nation from an early age, the education ministry in consultation with the defence ministry will work to include the valour of our soldiers into the school curriculum," he said.

102.title: Terrorism suspect blows himself up in Saudi Arabia, 4 injured
102.article_body: A terrorism suspect detonated an explosive device in Saudi Arabia's Jeddah on Wednesday as security forces attempted to arrest him, killing himself and injuring four others, state media reported on Friday. The man has been identified as Abdullah bin Zaid Abdulrahman Al-Bakry Al-Shihry. He was wanted in connection with a deadly 2015 bombing in the country.

103.title: 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie attacked during lecture in US
103.article_body: India-born author of 'The Satanic Verses', Salman Rushdie, was attacked on Friday as he was about to give a lecture at the Chautauqua Institution in New York, AP reported. A man stormed the stage Rushdie was on and punched or stabbed him during the author's introduction, AP said. Rushdie fell to the floor and his attacker was reportedly restrained.

104.title: Party will talk to Opposition to make Mamata PM candidate: TMC MP
104.article_body: Ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls, TMC MP Saugata Roy said his party will talk to others in the Opposition to make West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee a joint prime ministerial candidate. "Mamata Banerjee is leading in this. She's backed by this huge state," Roy said. "Our workers definitely want Mamata as the PM candidate," Roy added.

105.title: Man tasked by Pak's Jaish terror group to kill Nupur Sharma arrested: UP Police
105.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad on Friday arrested terrorist Muhammad Nadeem from Saharanpur. According to the agency, the accused was allegedly in direct contact with Pakistan-based terrorist outfits Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) and Tehrik-e Taliban Pakistan (TTP). He was tasked by JeM to kill Nupur Sharma, who was suspended from the BJP over her controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

106.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' gets 4.5/10 rating on IMDb with 55,000 1-star ratings
106.article_body: Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' currently has a rating of 4.5/10 on IMDb with over 55,000 one-star ratings. As of 8:25 pm on Friday, as many as 89,577 IMDb users have rated the movie, with 55,819 (62.3%) giving one star to it. As many as 21,063 users have given 10/10, while 6,102 gave 9/10 and 3,111 users gave 8/10.

107.title: Please don't boycott 'Laal...', people have worked so hard on it: Kareena
107.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan in an interview requested people not to boycott her latest film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Please don't boycott this film, because it's...like boycotting good cinema," she said, adding, "And people have worked so hard on it; we've had 250 people work on this film for two-and-a-half years." The film reportedly collected ₹12 crore on its opening day.

108.title: The Great Khali cries while posing for photographers, video leaves fans confused
108.article_body: A video has shown former WWE star Dalip Singh Rana aka The Great Khali suddenly crying while posing in front of photographers. Khali is seen walking toward the paparazzi waiting to photograph him and waving at them. He's then seen suddenly turning away from the cameras and wiping his eyes without saying anything, leaving fans confused.

109.title: Genelia is hilarious, I love watching her reels: Sonam Kapoor
109.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, during her appearance on Karan Johar's chat show 'Koffee With Karan', said that she likes the social media handle of Genelia Deshmukh. "I love watching her reels. She and Riteish (Deshmukh) are hilarious. I am constantly stalking her on social media," she said. Sonam appeared on 'Koffee With Karan' with Arjun Kapoor.

110.title: Developments from Bihar are encouraging to forge pro-people alternative: Raja
110.article_body: After meeting Bihar's Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav in Delhi on Friday, the General Secretary of the Communist Party of India, D Raja, has commented on the recent political change in the state. "Developments from Bihar are encouraging to forge a secular-democratic unity & pro-people alternative to RSS-BJP's divisive politics before general elections in 2024," Raja tweeted.

111.title: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik launches irrigation projects in Mayurbhanj
111.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Friday launched Deo and Subarnarekha irrigation projects in Mayurbhanj district and also laid the foundation stone for many developmental projects on Friday. Both the irrigation projects are expected to benefit the people of Mayurbhanj and Balasore districts, the Chief Minister's office informed. The CM added that ₹685 crore were invested for the Subarnarekha project.

112.title: 12, including 4 Nepali nationals, injured as bus hits divider in UP
112.article_body: At least 12 people, including three Nepali passengers and the bus driver, who is from Nepal, were injured after their bus rammed into the divider on Agra-Lucknow Expressway on Friday, officials said. Three Nepali passengers, Manju Darai, Bhanubhakt and Priti Pandey sustained critical injuries, police said. The bus, carrying 35 passengers, was travelling from Pokhara in Nepal to Delhi.

113.title: 10 Bangladeshi nationals, including 2 children, deported from Assam
113.article_body: At least 10 Bangladeshi nationals, including two children, who were caught on charges of entering the country illegally were reportedly deported to Bangladesh from Assam's Karimganj border on Thursday. "After a joint agreement between the offices concerned in India and Bangladesh, these people were sent," Assam Police said. They were handed over to representatives of Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB).

114.title: US-made missile defence system not negotiable: South Korea to China
114.article_body: South Korea on Thursday said that a US-made missile defence system deployed by the country can never be subject to negotiations with China. This comment comes after China demanded that South Korea not deploy any more batteries and limit the use of existing ones. South Korea had announced the installation of Terminal High Altitude Area Defence (THAAD) system in 2016.

115.title: UP man wins 22-yr-old case against Railways over ₹20 extra fee, to get over ₹15,000
115.article_body: A UP man recently won a 22-year-old court case against Railways which he filed after being wrongly charged ₹20 extra due to a clerk's error in 1999. Tungnath Chaturvedi was charged ₹90 for two tickets whose actual fare totalled ₹70. Railways will pay him a ₹15,000 fine, plus ₹20 at a 12% interest for each year from 1999 to 2022.

116.title: As a Chadha, I wholeheartedly endorse 'Laal Singh Chaddha': Richa Chadha
116.article_body: Amid the calls to boycott Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actress Richa Chadha wrote on Twitter, "As a Chadha, I wholeheartedly endorse #LaalSinghChaddha." "[The film] made us laugh and cry in unison...excellent work by ALL," she added. The film, also starring Kareena Kapoor Khan and Naga Chaitanya, is a remake of the Hollywood film 'Forrest Gump'.

117.title: Had crispy aromatic duck night before my 1st WC match, got out on duck: Ross Taylor
117.article_body: Ex-New Zealand batter Ross Taylor, in his book, revealed he had a superstition of not eating duck before matches. He added that the night before his first-ever World Cup match in 2007, he had a crispy aromatic duck and he got out for a duck in that match. "Rule number one...Don't have duck the night before a game," he wrote.

118.title: Shubman Gill's selfie with ₹500 note inside phone cover goes viral, fans react
118.article_body: A mirror selfie of cricketer Shubman Gill, wherein a ₹500 note can be seen inside his phone cover, went viral. The photo was shared by Gill on Instagram after getting his hair styled from celebrity hairstylist Aalim Hakim. "500 is glowing," a user wrote. "He also keeps ₹500 note in phone cover...at least something is common between us," another wrote.

119.title: What are the 'freebies' provided to Chief Justice of India: Jayant
119.article_body: After a Supreme Court bench termed the distribution of freebies by political parties as a "serious issue", RLD President Jayant Chaudhary asked that "what are the 'freebies' provided to the Chief Justice of India?". "Recent remarks by the SC...are not in the right spirit! The bottom of the pyramid needs direct intervention whether in ration or...financial support," Chaudhary tweeted.

120.title: 12-year-old girl raped, body found near railway track in Faridabad
120.article_body: The body of a 12-year-old girl who was allegedly raped and murdered was found near a railway track in Faridabad, police said on Friday. The minor had gone out to defecate in the evening hours, police added. According to police, her body was found after her family launched a search for her when she did not return for an hour.

121.title: Vehicles submerged as water level of Pune's Mutha river rises
121.article_body: The water level of the Mutha river in Pune rose after water was released from the Khadakwasla Dam on Thursday, following which several vehicles on riverside roads were submerged. As per reports, police, along with local residents, helped remove the submerged vehicles. The IMD has issued a heavy-rainfall alert in the city for this week.

122.title: Flag march held as Hindu groups seek to conduct puja at B'luru's Idgah Maidan
122.article_body: The Karnataka Police on Friday carried out a flag march at Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan, after some Hindu groups expressed their wish to organise a puja on Ganesh Chaturthi. A row in this connection began when Hindu activists claimed that the ground is for the public and not a property of the Waqf Board.

123.title: Can't trust those who don't hoist Tricolour on I-Day: U'khand BJP chief
123.article_body: Uttarakhand BJP chief Mahendra Bhatt said people who don't hoist the Tricolour on their houses on Independence Day cannot be trusted. "It is only natural. After all, why should any Indian have problems in hoisting the Tricolour on their houses to celebrate the occasion?" he said. He later clarified that his remark was "meant only for party workers".

124.title: Mumbai Police team visits Ranveer Singh's house to issue summons over his nude pics
124.article_body: A team from Mumbai Police on Friday went to Ranveer Singh's residence to issue him summons in connection with an FIR against him for posting his nude photographs on Instagram. He was not at his residence and the police were told he would be back on August 16. The team will once again visit his residence to serve the summons.

125.title: BCCI mulling to organise 1st women's IPL in March 2023: Report
125.article_body: The BCCI is reportedly planning to hold the first edition of the women's IPL in the March 2023 window. According to a report, BCCI is keen on this window, especially after deciding to begin the women's domestic season in October instead of November. Notably, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly had earlier said that the board wants a full-fledged WIPL from 2023.

126.title: India urges Canada to ensure adequate security for its I-Day events
126.article_body: The Indian High Commission has urged the Canadian government to ensure adequate security arrangements for India's Independence Day celebrations at its missions across Canada, and for events organised by the Indo-Canadian community. There was information suggesting pro-Khalistan and pro-Pakistan Kashmiri groups were "planning to disrupt" such events, Indian officials cited by Hindustan Times said.

127.title: NIA arrests 9th accused in Kanhaiya Lal murder case
127.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested one Muslim Khan in connection with the murder of Udaipur-based tailor Kanhaiya Lal, officials said. The 41-year-old accused, a resident of Rajasthan's Pratapgarh, played an "active role" in the conspiracy, the agency said. This is the ninth arrest made by the NIA in the case since taking over the investigation on June 29.

128.title: Locals claim BBMP is selling faulty national flags in Bengaluru
128.article_body: Locals from Bengaluru took to Twitter to allege that civic body BBMP is selling faulty national flags in the city. RTI activist Veeresh Bellur said the size of some flags wasn't even and the Ashoka Chakra wasn't placed correctly in some flags. A BBMP official said 1-2% of the flags it received from Kannada and Culture Department had "minor issues".

129.title: 2 Shiv Sena party workers booked for 'defaming' PM Modi
129.article_body: Two Shiv Sena party workers have been booked for allegedly sharing morphed photographs of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah with a derogatory message on social media. Both the accused reportedly belonged to the Yuva Sena. According to the police, while one of the accused shared the alleged post on social media, the other supported it.

130.title: 2 injured in attack by group in Delhi's Wazirabad
130.article_body: Two persons were injured after a group of 10 people attacked them in north Delhi's Wazirabad area, police said on Friday. Officials added that they received reports of shots being fired in the air in the area on Thursday night. The group was searching for one Deepak, after failing to find him it attacked passersby and damaged vehicles, police said.

131.title: Hatred was sown in society when BJP was in power: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi
131.article_body: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav accused BJP of causing communal disharmony in the state and said "hatred was sown in the society" under BJP's rule. "Issues like Hindu-Muslim and Mandir-Masjid were only discussed when BJP was in power," he said. "Since we've formed the government, issues like employment and those related to youth's future are being addressed," Tejashwi said.

132.title: Ex-BJP MLA's wife gets 4-yr jail term for circulating fake currency
132.article_body: The second wife of ex-BJP MLA Putkar Hembrom has been sentenced to four years in jail by Jharkhand court for circulating fake currency. A fine of ₹5,000 was also imposed on her. Earlier, a woman from Matkamhatu village claimed Malaya Hembrom had given her a ₹2,000 note, which wasn't accepted by SBI. She claimed Malaya attacked her on being confronted.

133.title: Raju Srivastava hasn't regained consciousness in the last 46 hours, tweets Shekhar Suman
133.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava, who was admitted to Delhi's AIIMS on Wednesday following a heart attack, hasn't regained consciousness in the last 46 hours, tweeted Shekhar Suman on Friday. "Please all Indians pray hard for his recovery. We can't afford to lose this gem. I'm sure he is going to come back. God is great," Suman added.

134.title: Mumbai Indians-owned UAE franchise announce their squad
134.article_body: Mumbai Indians-owned MI Emirates today announced their squad for inaugural edition of UAE's International League T20. The squad includes veteran West Indian all-rounders Kieron Pollard and Dwayne Bravo. It also includes English batter Will Smeed, who recently became the first cricketer to slam a hundred in The Hundred. Local players from UAE will be added to squad later, MI said.

135.title: Go First B'luru-Maldives flight makes emergency landing as faulty alarm gets triggered
135.article_body: A Go First Bengaluru-Male (Maldives) flight with 92 passengers made an emergency landing at Coimbatore airport after an alarm went off, warning about engine overheating, officials said. The flight was checked and engineers found that the alarm was faulty, officials said. They said the flight was declared fit for takeoff and was scheduled to leave after 5 pm.

136.title: Hyderabad businessman cheated of ₹1 crore in crypto fraud
136.article_body: A businessman in Hyderabad was allegedly cheated of ₹1 crore by fraudsters after investing in cryptocurrency. Police said the victim was added to a WhatsApp group that had people interested in cryptocurrency and upon contacting the investment firm, he was asked to download two applications. "Lured by [initial] profits, he invested around ₹1 crore...through direct payment," police said.

137.title: It's ridiculous: 'Good...' maker on calls to boycott 'Laal...', 'Raksha...'
137.article_body: Siddharth Sen, director of Janhvi Kapoor-starrer 'Good Luck Jerry', has reacted to social media trends demanding a boycott of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Raksha Bandhan' and Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "It's ridiculous," he said, adding that people who're doing it have too much time. "You pull out an old tweet and say don't watch, I'm finding it very absurd," said Siddharth.

138.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' becomes Aamir Khan's lowest opener in 13 years
138.article_body: Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' collected ₹10.75 crore on its opening day, as per Box Office India. This is the actor's lowest opening in the last 13 years. His 2018 film 'Thugs of Hindostan' had opened at ₹52 crore. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' recorded the third biggest opening for a Hindi film in 2022 after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Bachchhan Paandey'.

139.title: BJP ruining schools & hospitals so people go to private ones: Sisodia
139.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia criticised the BJP for "making fun of welfare schemes" and accused them of following "Dostwaadi" model. "They [BJP] believe in ruining schools and hospitals to...extent that people are forced to go to private schools and hospitals which mostly belong to their friends," Sisodia said. "They don't believe in giving free...education to students," he said.

140.title: Punjab Cong MP's assistant attacked by over 12 people in Ludhiana
140.article_body: Punjab Congress MP Ravneet Singh Bittu's assistant Harjinder Singh Dhindsa was allegedly attacked by about 12 to 15 people in Ludhiana on Friday. Dhindsa was attacked with sharp-edged weapons and was rushed to a private hospital, police said. "He has multiple injuries on his body, including his head," Dr Bhagwan Singh, chairman of the hospital where Dhindsa was admitted, said.

141.title: Gurugram civic body forms 35 teams to enforce 9-day meat ban
141.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram has set up 35 teams to ensure all meat shops under its limits remain closed during the Jain festival 'Paryushan Parv' from August 24 to September 1. In an earlier order, the municipality said the closure will affect 130 licensed meat shops. A penalty of ₹5,000 will be imposed on erring shops, an official said.

142.title: COVID positive burglar handcuffed to bed flees Kasturba hospital in Mumbai
142.article_body: A 22-year-old alleged burglar tested positive for COVID-19 and was admitted to Mumbai's Kasturba hospital. He was handcuffed to his bed in the COVID-19 ICU ward as police weren't allowed there to avoid infection. But, he somehow managed to escape through the hospital's toilet window. Police, however, caught him within 24 hours and brought him back to the same ward.

143.title: Global youth unemployment would decline to 7.3 cr in 2022, says UN
143.article_body: A UN report on Thursday said that the total global number of unemployed youths would decline to 7.3 crore in 2022, down by 20 lakh from the year before. However, this year's number is still 60 lakh higher than the pre-pandemic level of 2019, it added. The pandemic exacerbated the market challenges generally facing young people, it further said.

144.title: Priyanka, Nick not a good match, he looks so small in front of her: Sima
144.article_body: Sima Taparia of 'Indian Matchmaking' has said she doesn't think Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas are a good pair. "They have married, but it's not a good match. He looks so small and petite in front of her, and she looks elder," Sima said in an episode of the series. Priyanka and Nick have an age gap of 10 years.

145.title: Tejashwi Yadav to meet Sonia Gandhi in Delhi ahead of floor test
145.article_body: Bihar's new Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav will meet Congress chief Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Friday. This comes ahead of the August 24 floor test in the Bihar Assembly. After the RJD came back to power by aligning with rival Nitish Kumar's JDU, Tejashwi visited Delhi for Raksha Bandhan and to meet his father Lalu Prasad Yadav.

146.title: Over 77,000 seats vacant after 1st round of FYJC admissions in Pune
146.article_body: As many as 77,130 seats remained vacant after completion of the first regular round of admissions for first-year junior college (FYJC) or Class 11 in the Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad regions. In the first round, only 31,700 students were admitted out of 1.03 lakh students who registered online for the admission process. The second round of admissions started on Friday.

147.title: 7-yr-old attacked by 2 fighting bulls dies due to head injuries in Noida
147.article_body: A seven-year-old girl, who was attacked by stray bulls in Noida's Salarpur, died due to severe head injuries, police said. The girl was passing by D K Water Supplier in Kalika Enclave in Salarpur on Thursday afternoon when the incident took place. She was reportedly caught in a fight between the two bulls in a narrow lane in the area.

148.title: Anti-encroachment notices put up in Gurugram's Sushant Lok 1 market
148.article_body: The Department of Town and Country Planning on Wednesday put up notices in Gurugram's Sushant Lok 1 market directing shop owners and market association to clear illegal encroachments. A demolition drive will be carried out if the encroachments are not removed voluntarily, an official said. Corrective actions were not taken by shop owners following an anti-encroachment drive earlier, he informed.

149.title: India concerned at recent developments: Govt amid China-Taiwan tensions
149.article_body: India is "concerned" about the recent developments in the Taiwan Strait where China and Taiwan recently conducted military exercises amid high tensions, the government has said. "We urge the exercise of restraint...de-escalation of tension and efforts to maintain peace and stability," said MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi. Tensions began over the US House of Representatives Nancy Pelosi's visit.

150.title: 1,300 shows of 'Laal Singh...' reduced by exhibitors after low turnout: Report
150.article_body: Exhibitors have voluntarily reduced shows of both 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' due to low turnout, said a report. While approximately 1,300 shows of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' have been reduced, 'Raksha Bandhan' has seen a reduction of 1,000 shows across the country, it added. The films reportedly failed to earn a combined total of ₹20 crore on opening day.

151.title: Massive portion of flyover on Shimla-Kalka highway collapses, 2 cars fall off
151.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a massive portion of flyover on Shimla-Kalka highway having collapsed. The collapse occurred after heavy rains in the area. In the video, two cars can be seen damaged after falling off the flyover. Further, trucks and other vehicles on the highway can be seen slowly reversing to get to safety.

152.title: Retail inflation eases to 6.71% in July from 7.01% in June, lowest since March
152.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), eased to 6.71% in the month of July from 7.01% in June. It is the lowest since March, when CPI was recorded to be 6.95%. In May, it stood at 7.04% and in April it had hit an eight-year-high of 7.79%.

153.title: Solar storm causes purple-green aurora to appear in Canada, pics surface
153.article_body: Unusual streaks of purple-green lights were seen in Canadian skies recently after a solar storm hit the Earth. Pictures of the aurora or northern lights were shared by astronomy author and photographer Alan Dyer, who said they were visible for about 40 minutes. The lights were seen due to a rare phenomenon called Strong Thermal Emission Velocity Enhancement or STEVE.

154.title: 'Jungle raj' has returned to Bihar: BJP on RJD-JD(U) alliance
154.article_body: After the RJD-JD(U) government assumed power in Bihar, BJP on Friday cited several crimes since the alliance formed and alleged that 'jungle raj' has returned to Bihar. "Disorder is spreading in the state at a fast pace," BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said. He claimed that BJP's presence in the state government earlier worked as a restraining influence on crime.

155.title: Hyd police buildings illuminated with Tricolour lights; pics emerge
155.article_body: All police buildings in Hyderabad have been illuminated with Tricolour lights ahead of the 75th Independence Day, Commissioner of Police CV Anand said. Hyderabad City Police shared pictures of the Commissioner's office and Telangana State Police Integrated Command and Control Center decorated with Tricolour lights. A picture of the illuminated Jubilee Hills Police Station was shared by its SHO.

156.title: Kerala Guv's interventions in govt matters weaken democratic process: CPI(M)
156.article_body: The CPI(M) Kerala Secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan has said that state Governor Arif Mohammed Khan's interventions in state government matters would weaken the democratic process. "The governor (Khan) is meddling in [govt] matters in an undemocratic manner. The government and governor should work together as two constitutional bodies but the act of the governor does not reflect it," Kodiyeri said.

157.title: Pit bull seriously injures domestic help in Gurugram, FIR filed
157.article_body: A domestic help working in Gurugram was mauled by a pit bull leaving her with serious injuries on her head and face, police said. An FIR has been filed after the victim's family claimed the pit bull was let loose from its leash during its morning walk. The dog allegedly knocked the 30-year-old woman down and bit her all over.

158.title: 1st Agnipath recruitment rally for Pune zone to be held on Aug 13
158.article_body: The first Agnipath Army recruitment rally for the Pune Recruiting Zone will begin on Saturday in Aurangabad. In total, eight recruitment rallies will be held for the Pune Recruiting Zone, including one rally for Agniveer Women Military Police. "The response for the Agnipath scheme has been enthusiastic and the youth have registered adequately," the Army said in a statement.

159.title: Sri Lanka's ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa arrives in Thailand
159.article_body: Sri Lanka's former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Thursday arrived in Thailand, where he is expected to stay temporarily. Rajapaksa had arrived at Bangkok's Don Mueang International Airport on a chartered flight from Singapore. Notably, Rajapaksa, who holds a diplomatic passport, has made no public appearances or comments since fleeing Sri Lanka last month amid mass protests.

160.title: National Award-winning singer Shivamogga Subbanna dies of heart attack at 83
160.article_body: National Award-winning singer Shivamogga Subbanna passed away on Thursday night at a hospital in Bengaluru following a heart attack. He was 83. Shivamogga won a National Award for the song, 'Kaadu Kudure Odi Banditta' from the film 'Kaadu Kudure'. He was the first Kannadiga to win a National Award for playback singing.

161.title: Trump calls for 'immediate' release of FBI warrant used to search his home
161.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump called for the "immediate" release of the warrant the FBI used to search his Florida home this week. This came hours after US Justice Department asked a court to unseal the warrant. The search was part of an investigation into whether Trump illegally removed records from White House as he left office in January 2021.

162.title: Man drowns in Mumbai's Mahim creek, body recovered; another feared dead
162.article_body:
A 28-year-old man drowned in Mumbai's Mahim creek and his body was recovered on Friday morning, while another person accompanying him was feared dead, officials said. The fire brigade was alerted after two men had gone missing from Mahim causeway on Thursday night.
"The body of Javed Alam Shaikh...was found floating in the creek near...Reclamation flyover bridge," the official said.

163.title: Rupee closes 4 paise lower at 79.66 against US dollar
163.article_body: The rupee fell 4 paise to close at 79.66 (provisional) against the US dollar on Friday amid rising crude oil prices and a strong dollar. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the rupee opened at 79.67 and saw an intra-day high of 79.63 and a low of 79.72 against the dollar. The dollar index rose 0.26% to 105.36.

164.title: Sussanne, Bobby attend Arjun Kanungo-Carla's wedding reception, pics surface
164.article_body: The wedding reception of newly-married couple, singer Arjun Kanungo and South African model Carla Dennis on Thursday was attended by several celebrities from the film industry. The guests included Sussanne Khan, Arslan Goni, Bobby Deol, Tanya Deol, Kubbra Sait and many others. Arjun and Carla got married on August 10 in Mumbai.

165.title: Alliance with Shiv Sena is not permanent: Congress' Nana Patole
165.article_body: Commenting on ties with Shiv Sena, Congress leader Nana Patole said, "We had an alliance with them in a different situation. This is not our natural or permanent alliance." He also commented on the Eknath Shinde and Devendra Fadnavis-led new government and alleged that it was formed using central agencies and funds.

166.title: Mob attacks 2 in Delhi after they fail to find man they were looking for
166.article_body: A video showing a group of around 10 people attacking two persons after they failed to find a man they were looking for in Delhi's Wazirabad on Thursday has surfaced online. According to the police, they were searching for a man named Deepak. When they failed to find him, they attacked two passers-by, Jatin (17) and Ajay (42), injuring them.

167.title: Man arrested for dowry death after wife dies by suicide in Gurugram
167.article_body: A man has been arrested on dowry death charge after his 19-year-old wife allegedly died by suicide in Gurugram's Chandu village on Tuesday, police informed on Friday. According to police, a case of murder was initially registered against the accused following a complaint by deceased's family. However, probe later revealed that the woman died by suicide, an officer told media.

168.title: Man takes hostages at bank in bid to get his trapped money in crisis-hit Lebanon
168.article_body: A man entered a bank in crisis-hit Lebanon's Beirut and held at least 10 people hostage demanding access to his own trapped money, according to The Washington Post. A video showing police trying to calm the man down surfaced on social media. The man, who had about $200,000 stuck in the bank, surrendered after a seven-hour-long standoff.

169.title: Karnataka HC abolishes Anti Corruption Bureau, cases transferred to Lokayukta
169.article_body: The Karnataka HC abolished the Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) formed by the then Congress state government in 2016 and transferred all the pending cases to the Lokayukta Police division. "If really the government intends to curb corruption, favouritism and official indiscipline in administration machinery, the ACB should have been allowed to work under the control of Lokayukta," the court said.

170.title: 3 die after inhaling poisonous gas inside well in MP's Sagar
170.article_body: Three people died after inhaling a poisonous gas on entering a well in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district on Thursday evening, police said. The victims reportedly entered the 60-feet-deep well to remove a motor, but inhaled some poisonous gas emanating from it, following which they fell unconscious and drowned. They were aged between 25 and 65 years, an official said.

171.title: Akshay's fans dance in theatre during 'Raksha Bandhan' show, video surfaces
171.article_body: A video showing fans of Akshay Kumar dancing in a theatre during the screening of 'Raksha Bandhan' has surfaced online. In the video, people could be seen dancing in front of the screen while a song from the film played in the background. The Aanand L Rai directorial collected ₹8.20 crore on Thursday, according to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh.

172.title: BJP didn't follow 'coalition dharma': JD(U) leader Lalan Singh
172.article_body: JD(U) leader Lalan Singh accused BJP of violating "coalition dharma" by trying to sabotage his party. He said that CM Nitish Kumar was under pressure from his own party members to pull out of the alliance. "The present BJP leadership should tell how many NDA allies are still left in the alliance as compared to 2014," Singh further said.

173.title: Somalia’s worst drought in 40 years displaces 1 million people
173.article_body: A "devastating drought" in Somalia has internally displaced one million people since the dry conditions struck in January, the UN refugee agency, UNHCR, said. "Somalia is going through a two-year historic dry spell, the likes of which haven't been seen in over 40 years," UNHCR said, adding, "An expected fifth failed rainy season is set to displace many more families."

174.title: 'Chor, chor' slogans raised as CBI produces Anubrata Mondal in court
174.article_body: Several people shouted slogans of 'chor, chor' while the Central Bureau of Investigation produced TMC leader Anubrata Mondal in a special court on Thursday in connection with cattle smuggling case, reports said. Reports added that people also showed shoes to the TMC leader. Meanwhile, Mondal was on Thursday sent to the CBI custody till August 20 by the Asansol court.
