175.title: Rly police recover body packed in gunny bag from train in Bihar
175.article_body: Railway police have recovered a burnt body that was packed inside a gunny bag, which they found lying beside a toilet, from a passenger train in Bihar's Katihar on Thursday. "The man...was first killed and then his face was burnt with acid to hide his identity," an official said. The body was found after passengers complained about a foul smell.

176.title: B'luru Metro fare from Lalbagh station to cost ₹30 from August 13 to 15
176.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has announced a paper ticket system which will cost ₹30 to all stations from Lalbagh metro station. The tickets will be issued from August 13-15 and will be valid for a single trip, BMRCL said. The move will encourage people visiting  Independence Day Flower Show at Lalbagh Botanical Garden to use public transport.

177.title: Fire tornado caught on camera amid massive blaze in US, video released
177.article_body: Aerial footage of a fire tornado or a 'firenado' that formed amid a massive wildfire in US' California has been released online. The 'firenado' was spotted amid a brush fire that erupted on Wednesday in Gorman and spread to around 150 acres. Around 200 firefighters were called to fight the massive blaze.

178.title: I'm glad she said what she thought: Vijay on Ananya criticising 'Arjun Reddy'
178.article_body: On being asked about Ananya Panday's criticism of 'Arjun Reddy', actor Vijay Deverakonda said he is glad that she said what she thought. "I might not agree or disagree or I might even see both sides of the coin but it's okay," he added. Ananya had said that she won't accept the behaviours portrayed in the film in real life.

179.title: Manushi Chhillar was the first choice for 'Laal Singh Chaddha': Report
179.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar was the first choice for the role of Rupa in Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', reported Bollywood Hungama. As per the report, the actress turned it down due to her contract with Yash Raj Films and made her debut in 'Samrat Prithviraj' opposite Akshay Kumar. The role of Rupa is portrayed by Kareena Kapoor.

180.title: 'Tiranga shikara rally' organised at Dal Lake in Srinagar
180.article_body: The Youth Services and Sports Department of Jammu and Kashmir organised a 'Tiranga shikara rally' at Dal Lake in Srinagar ahead of Independence Day. The rally was flagged off by Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha under the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The campaign aims to encourage every citizen to bring home the National Flag and hoist it with pride.

181.title: Over 2 lakh PACS needed to meet agri-finance target: Amit Shah
181.article_body: Home and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah said that more than 2 lakh new primary agriculture credit societies (PACS) are needed across the country to meet the target of providing agri-finance worth ₹10 lakh crore through cooperatives. At a national conference on rural cooperative banks on Friday, he said that there are over 95,000 PACS, however, only about 63,000 are functional.

182.title: Allu Arjun's slipper step in 'Srivalli' was actually a mistake: Big B
182.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan has revealed that actor Allu Arjun's step with his slipper in the song 'Srivalli' was actually a mistake. The actor said that Sukumar, who directed the film 'Pushpa: The Rise', told him while he was shooting in Hyderabad that Allu Arjun missed his slipper and it became a step. The film collected over ₹360 crore worldwide.

183.title: Can find replacement for Kohli, Rohit but not Hardik: Aakash on T20Is
183.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra said Team India "can find a replacement" for Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah in their T20I lineup for tournaments like Asia Cup and T20 World Cup 2022. "But if Hardik Pandya's not there, you cannot make that XI," added Aakash. "Hardik's the only player in the squad who is providing that balance," he stated.

184.title: Mumbai Police wrongly list Haryana man's number as senior inspector
184.article_body: Mumbai Police allegedly uploaded a Haryana man's mobile number on their website mistakenly as that of the senior police inspector of the Agripada PS. The 37-year-old Sanjay Dagar reportedly received 50-70 calls daily which included complaints about molestation or tip-offs from police sources. However, the Mumbai Police have said that they will check the contact details on their website soon.

185.title: Perseid meteor shower expected to peak tonight, NASA reveals when and where to spot it
185.article_body: The Perseid meteor shower is expected to peak late Friday night into early Saturday morning. "If you do decide to look for these meteors, the best time should be after midnight...You'll need to be far from...city...in a place with no clouds...and have...clear view of...large expanse of sky. You'll need to look northward away from the glow of...Moon," said NASA.

186.title: BMC to set up 9 mini waste-to-energy plants in Mumbai
186.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is setting up nine mini waste-to-energy or biomethanisation plants across Mumbai with the capacity to process two metric tonnes (MT) of organic waste per day. Currently, three mini waste-to-energy plants are operational. "Wards have been directed to find suitable plots in their jurisdiction to set up...nine biomethanisation plants," an official said.

187.title: Ex-German Chancellor sues Parliament over stripped privileges: Report
187.article_body: Former German Chancellor Gerhard Schröder has sued the German Parliament, Bundestag, in a bid to restore special privileges he was stripped of in May, German news agency DPA reported on Friday. The Parliament had taken away some of Schröder's special rights and privileges for refusing to cut ties with Russian President Vladimir Putin following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

188.title: Don't be so shameless: Tejashwi Yadav to Giriraj over his tweet
188.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav criticised Union Minister Giriraj Singh over his tweet in which Singh taunted Yadav for being unable to fulfil his promise of providing one million jobs. Yadav said, "Sir, don't be so shameless...This is the plight of the BJP. Only because of these idiotic antics, edited videos...,these poor people have no face in Bihar."

189.title: SC directs states to file affidavits on Haj Committees within 2 weeks
189.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday directed the state governments to file affidavits on Haj Committees within two weeks. SC has asked the states to inform it on whether Haj Committees have been constituted and to specify the names of committee members. This comes after a petition claimed that many states have not filed compliance reports under the Haj Committee Act, 2002.

190.title: Cyberabad Police solve double murder of migrant workers, 1 held
190.article_body: A migrant worker from Jharkhand, Bhuvaneswar Singh, was arrested by Cyberabad Police for allegedly murdering two migrant workers from Jharkhand. Police said Singh was arrested from his relatives' house in Jharkhand, where he was hiding. The case was initially suspected to be an accidental gas leak, but after 17 days of probe, the police arrested Singh, who confessed during questioning.

191.title: Tie-up with Nitish Kumar's JD(U) 'natural alliance, not deal': Tejashwi
191.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Thursday said the tie-up between CM Nitish Kumar's JD(U) and 'Mahagathbandhan' is a "natural alliance and not a deal". "This is...real 'Mahagathbandhan' which was formed by Lalu Yadav...and Nitish Kumar. We welcomed Nitish Kumar's decision and came together," Tejashwi added. He further said within one month Bihar will be the single-largest job providing state.

192.title: 'Thor 4' came out of nowhere, did 400 push ups on day of my shot: Brett
192.article_body: Brett Goldstein, who portrayed Hercules in the post-credits scene of 'Thor: Love and Thunder', said that the offer came "out of nowhere". Brett said he was given two weeks to prepare and told director Taika Waititi that he's "basically...a skinny comedian". "I'm doing 400 push-ups that day. I was fit to explode. I did the best I could," he added.

193.title: 9-year-old girl who disliked school dies by suicide in Hyd: Report
193.article_body: A nine-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide in Begumpet, Hyderabad, on Thursday as she disliked attending school, a report said. Police said the class five student of a private school had skipped classes for six days. She reportedly hanged herself in her house while her six-year-old brother watched. The incident happened after her mother, a domestic worker, left for work.

194.title: Politics should be kept away from sports: Robert Vadra
194.article_body: Reacting to the row over Aam Aadmi Party denying a cash reward to wrestler Divya Kakran, Priyanka Gandhi's husband Robert Vadra said that politics should not be brought into sports. "I think we should be proud of them as Indians holistically and we should help them. It's not that the Delhi government has to help only Delhi sportspersons," said Vadra.

195.title: Hacker offers to sell data of Shanghai's COVID app's 48.5 mn users
195.article_body: A hacker, who goes by the username "XJP", has claimed to have access to the personal information of the users of Shanghai's COVID-19 health code mobile app. The hacker posted an offer on Breach Forums to sell the data of 48.5 million users for $4,000. XJP also gave a sample of the data, including the details of 47 users.

196.title: Why aren't AAP MLAs' kids studying in Delhi govt schools?: Joshi
196.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi has criticised Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, calling him a "liar". "[Kejriwal has] promised free electricity in many states. What has he provided in Delhi? Questions have been raised," he said. He also questioned why the children of AAP MLAs aren't studying in the national capital's government schools if the schools are functioning well.

197.title: Hong Kong reports record decline in population amid COVID curbs
197.article_body: Hong Kong on Thursday reported a record decline in its population as COVID-19 curbs hampered the inflow of new workers and births declined. The city saw a decline of 1,21,500 residents in the year ended June 30, leaving the population at about 72.9 lakh. The death rate has risen gradually due to the ageing of the population, the government said.

198.title: Britain's economy drops by 0.1% in Q2 amid fears over recession
198.article_body: Britain's economy contracted in the second quarter with the GDP dropping 0.1% in the April-June period. It had witnessed a rise of 0.8% in the first quarter, the Office for National Statistics (ONS) said on Friday. The UK economy fell 0.6% in June, the ONS added. The Bank of England expects the economy to fall into recession this year.

199.title: 25-yr-old man stabbed to death in crowded Malviya Nagar market in Delhi; video surfaces
199.article_body: A 25-year-old man was stabbed to death by a group of four-five men in a crowded market in South Delhi's Malviya Nagar area, police said. A video of the incident has surfaced online, showing the accused men chasing the victim before stabbing him multiple times as onlookers watched. Police said they have filed an FIR.

200.title: Man rapes business partner at 5-star Bengaluru hotel after calling her for meeting
200.article_body: A man raped his business partner at a 5-star hotel in Bengaluru after calling her for a meeting on August 6, police said. The accused, who hails from Tamil Nadu, is absconding, police further said. The police added that an FIR was registered on August 10 and that teams have been deployed to trace the accused.

201.title: Crimea blasts degrade Russia’s Black Sea air fleet: UK
201.article_body: Blasts at the Russian-operated Saky military airfield in Crimea this week have "degraded" its navy's Black Sea aviation fleet, UK's Defence Ministry said, adding Russia has lost eight fighter jets. The lost jets are only a fraction of the overall aviation fleet, but it'll be a "significant" setback since Saky is used as a primary operational base, it added.

202.title: 2 foetuses found dumped in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal; probe underway
202.article_body: Two foetuses were found dumped in different areas of Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said on Friday. While one foetus was found floating in a drain in front of Sultania Hospital three days ago, another was found in a puddle under Katara Hills police station area two days ago. Both foetuses were sent to ascertain their age, police said.

203.title: Double-decker bus hits divider, falls into gorge in UP; 36 injured
203.article_body: At least 36 passengers have been injured after a double-decker bus fell into a gorge in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad after hitting the divider on Agra-Lucknow Expressway on Friday, officials said. All passengers were taken to a hospital and 28 of the injured were hospitalised while the rest were discharged after first aid, officials added. The incident occurred around 1 am.

204.title: TMC to hold protests over leader Anubrata's arrest in cattle smuggling scam
204.article_body: After CBI arrested TMC leader Anubrata Mondal in connection with cattle smuggling scam, the party has announced to hold two-day protests from Friday against the alleged misuse of power. "Agencies should treat all suspects equally. No move has been made against BJP’s Suvendu Adhikari in the Saradha and Narada cases although he is an accused," said Bengal minister Chandrima Bhattacharya.

205.title: 3 sandalwood trees stolen from cantonment area in Pune's Wanowrie
205.article_body: Three sandalwood trees were reportedly axed and stolen from bungalow number 5 located on the Right Flank Road behind Command Hospital in the cantonment area of Pune's Wanowrie on August 5. In his FIR, the 62-year-old bungalow owner, Dilip Chavan, alleged that two of the stolen trees were between 8-10 feet in height, and the other was 5-7 feet tall.

206.title: UGC proposes to merge NEET, JEE exams into Common University Entrance Test
206.article_body: UGC Chairman Professor M Jagadesh Kumar said the Commission has proposed to merge the medical/dental entrance exam NEET and engineering entrance exam JEE into the Common University Entrance Test (CUET). The proposal's aim is to not subject students to the "stress" of multiple entrance tests based on the same knowledge base, the Times of India quoted Kumar as saying.

207.title: DCW chair sends rakhi to Jaishankar, seeks justice for Mandeep Kaur
207.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) Chairperson Swati Maliwal sent a rakhi to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Thursday. She also sent him a letter seeking justice for Mandeep Kaur, who died by suicide in America allegedly over domestic abuse. On behalf of DCW, Maliwal urged the minister to help bring Kaur's mortal remains back to her family in India.

208.title: OnePlus 10T with 16GB RAM to go on sale on August 16
208.article_body: OnePlus has announced the sale of the OnePlus 10T 16GB RAM variant starting from August 16. The phone features the signature 150W SUPERVOOC Endurance Edition charging, 50 MP triple camera, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chipset and 256GB UFS 3.1 storage. Users can buy the smartphone for the price of ₹55,999.

209.title: People exposed to COVID-19 no longer need to quarantine: US CDC
209.article_body: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said that it is no longer recommending that adults and children quarantine after having been exposed to COVID-19. The CDC added that it was also dropping its "test-to-stay" policy, which required students exposed to the virus to take regular tests to remain in the classroom or in childcare settings.

210.title: 2 killed, 6 injured in communal clashes in K'taka's Koppal; 25 held
210.article_body: Two people were killed and six others injured after clashes broke out between two communities in Karnataka's Koppal on Thursday. "More than 25 people were taken into custody in Hulihyder village [in connection with] the violence which occurred at the time of Muharram," Koppal SP said. Police have asked authorities to impose Section 144 for seven days, the SP added.

211.title: Jahangirpuri violence accused gets interim bail for wife's delivery
211.article_body: A Delhi court granted interim bail for one week to an accused in the Jahangirpuri violence case as his wife is due for delivery on August 22. "He may flee away...situation in the area is still charged up...applicant's release may again flare up the situation," the prosecution said. Communal clashes broke out in Jahangirpuri during a procession in April.

212.title: Google fined $43 mn for misleading users about location data in Aus
212.article_body: Google has been fined nearly $43 million in Australia for misleading users about collection of personal location data on Android phones. Google made it seem that it can only collect location data via 'Location History' setting, when 'Web & App Activity' setting allowed it to do the same. Australian Competition & Consumer Commission filed a case against Google in 2019.

213.title: MD of BYJU'S-owned Aakash buys Delhi bungalow worth ₹137 crore: Report
213.article_body: Aakash Chaudhry, the Managing Director of Aakash Educational Services Limited, has bought a bungalow worth ₹137 crore in Delhi's Chanakyapuri area, documents accessed by Zapkey.com showed. Chaudhry paid a stamp duty of ₹8.2 crore for the 1,293 square metre property. This is the third high value property bought by Chaudhry family after BYJU'S acquired Aakash for $950 million last year.

214.title: Story that inspired us all: Sidharth marks one year of 'Shershaah'
214.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra on Friday took to social media to mark one year since the release of his film 'Shershaah'. Sharing a video montage, the actor wrote, "One film, one year, one story that inspired us all! Your love, support & appreciation for this film has said enough." He further wrote, "#1YearOfShershaah aur "yeh dil maange more!""

215.title: Government issues flood warning for Yamuna river in Delhi
215.article_body: Central Water Commission has issued a flood warning for the Yamuna river in Delhi. Over 3,00,000 cusecs of water has been reportedly released into the Yamuna from Hathnikund Barrage in Haryana's Yamunanagar. The present level at the Old Railway Bridge, the benchmark for assessing the flood situation in Delhi, is 204.29 m, while the danger mark is 205.33 m.

216.title: Instagram can track everything users do on iOS via in-app browser: Google ex-engineer
216.article_body: Instagram and Facebook can track a user's web activity through the in-app browser on their iOS apps, according to a former Google engineer's research. The apps open all external links in an in-app browser, allowing them to monitor everything a user does without any consent, said Felix Krause. He claimed that tracked data included passwords, addresses and credit card numbers.

217.title: Those who can't cook find flaws in dish: 'Laal...' actor on low opening
217.article_body: Reacting to 'Laal Singh Chaddha' recording Aamir Khan's lowest opening in last 13 years as per Box Office India, the film's actor Harry Parmar said, "Those who cannot cook...easily point out flaws in a dish." "Please see the effort behind making a film. It takes extreme man-hours, a thousand hours of creative process and a lot of money," added Harry.

218.title: India Maharajas to face World XI in match to mark 75 years of independence, teams out
218.article_body: India Maharajas will face World Giants in a special Legends League Cricket match on September 16 to celebrate India's 75 years of independence. India Maharajas will be led by Sourav Ganguly, while World Giants will be captained by Eoin Morgan. The match will take place at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. India's squad also includes Virender Sehwag and Harbhajan Singh.

219.title: Govt issues clarification as reports claim tenants will pay 18% GST on house rent
219.article_body: The government on Friday issued a clarification as reports said that tenants would have to pay 18% GST on house rent. "Renting of a residential unit (is) taxable only when it is rented to a business entity," clarified the government. It added that properties rented to private or business persons for personal use and residence would not attract any GST.

220.title: Russell shares screenshot of Simmons 'beg' remark, says 'I am going to stay quiet'
220.article_body: All-rounder Andre Russell took to Instagram to share a screenshot of a news article wherein West Indies head coach Phil Simmons had stated that he won't beg players to play for West Indies. "I know this was coming but I am going to stay quiet!" Russell wrote. The article had stated that Russell hasn't made himself available for selection.

221.title: Can't kiss her goodbye, Indian govt considers me a criminal: Leena on grandmother's death
221.article_body: Filmmaker Leena Manimekalai, who faces FIRs over a film poster wherein goddess Kali is shown smoking, shared news of her grandmother's death and described how she couldn't "kiss her a goodbye". "I'm stuck in Toronto because I'm a 'criminal' according to Indian Government," she stated. "I don't understand why I'm alive when I can't even kiss her...farewell," Leena added.

222.title: TMC workers who were with Mamata to loot, murder will be abandoned: Malviya
222.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party leader Amit Malviya said West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee stopped picking calls from Partha Chatterjee and Anubrata Mondal after investigation against them by the central agencies. "Message for other ministers, TMC workers and bureaucrats, who have colluded with her to loot, murder and rape - you too will be abandoned," he wrote on Twitter.

223.title: Microsoft told 200 staff to 'find another position in 60 days or take severance': Report
223.article_body: Microsoft has reportedly laid off around 200 employees from its Modern Life Experiences team, which focuses on winning back consumers. According to Business Insider, Microsoft asked the affected employees to either find another position at the company within 60 days or take severance pay. The layoffs come weeks after Microsoft cut about 1% of its 180,000-person workforce in July.

224.title: Adani Group to invest ₹57,575 crore in two projects in Odisha
224.article_body: The Adani Group will invest ₹57,575 crore to set up two projects, an alumina refinery and an iron ore project, in Odisha. Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik-headed High-Level Clearance Authority of Odisha approved the projects that are expected to create 9,300 direct jobs. The alumina refinery will be set up near potential bauxite reserves or operational mines.

225.title: Thousands rally in Brazil in ‘defence of democracy’ ahead of Prez polls
225.article_body: Thousands of people took to the streets in Brazil on Thursday in "defence of democracy". The protests come amid attacks by President Jair Bolsonaro on the country's voting system that have raised fears that he could reject the results of October's Presidential election. Protesters were seen carrying banners like "Respect the vote, respect the people" and chanting "Out with Bolsonaro".

226.title: 8-yr-old girl raped by Panchayat head's husband in J'khand's Giridih
226.article_body: An eight-year-old girl was allegedly raped by the husband of a Panchayat head in Jharkhand's Giridih district on Thursday afternoon, police said. The incident reportedly occurred when the girl had gone to local Panchayat head Kanchan Devi's home to handover her soap. The police have formed three teams to arrest the accused who has gone missing after the incident.

227.title: Anne Heche not expected to survive: Family after actress crashes car into US home
227.article_body: Actress Anne Heche, who was hospitalised after crashing her car into a home in US' Los Angeles, has suffered a severe anoxic brain injury and is not expected to survive, her family spokesperson has said. The 53-year-old has been in coma after the crash last week and allegedly had drugs in her system. She has been kept on life support.

228.title: Anne Heche was under influence of cocaine during car crash: Report
228.article_body: Actress Anne Heche, who is critical after crashing her car into a house in Los Angeles, was under the influence of cocaine during the accident, reported TMZ. The report added that cocaine and fentanyl were found in her system but the fentanyl could have been present due to the pain medication provided at the hospital. The accident occurred last Friday.

229.title: Team should revolve around Suryakumar, he doesn't need to be slotted: Rohan
229.article_body: Reacting to former selector Saba Karim stating that Suryakumar Yadav can be slotted at number four in India's T20I team, cricketer-turned-commentator Rohan Gavaskar said, "Suryakumar doesn't need to be slotted...This...team needs to revolve around him." "You've got to figure out where is the best you can get out of him," added Rohan. Rohan stated that certain spots are however "non-negotiable".

230.title: Paytm shares fall after advisory firm opposes CEO's reappointment
230.article_body: Paytm shares fell by 6.2% on Friday after the Institutional Investor Advisory Services India advised shareholders to vote against the reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as the CEO of Paytm's parent One97 Communications. The RBI's new guidelines for digital lending apps also drove the shares to decline as this could operationally impact its buy-now-pay-later business, Paytm told investors.

231.title: Man hides ₹43 lakh-gold in undergarment, held at airport in K'taka
231.article_body: Customs officials have seized gold worth over ₹43 lakh from a male passenger at Mangaluru International Airport in Karnataka. The man had put the gold, which was in paste form, in a white adhesive tape pouch and hidden it inside a stitched pocket of the undergarment that he was wearing, officials said. The accused had arrived from Dubai on Wednesday.

232.title: No parking at Delhi Metro stations from 6 am on Aug 14 till 2 pm on Aug 15
232.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) said that in view of the security measures for Independence Day, parking facilities will not be available at Metro stations from 6 am on August 14 till 2 pm on August 15. Metro train services will continue to run as per normal schedule, DMRC added. Notably, 2,000 live cartridges were recovered in Delhi on Friday.

233.title: Playing a mom won't take away my mojo, but I'd play my age: Mini Mathur
233.article_body: Actress Mini Mathur said that she doesn't know why there is "a strange backfooted attitude" about playing a mother onscreen, adding that it won't "take away [her] mojo". Mini further said being "someone's mother" is not enough and wants to do roles appropriate for her. "I would ask them to cast me for the age that I am," she added.

234.title: Xiaomi unveils humanoid robot prototype worth ₹82 lakh that can read human emotions
234.article_body: Xiaomi has unveiled a humanoid robot prototype, called CyberOne, which has the ability to read human emotions. It has a face in the form of a curved OLED panel and is equipped with two cameras, allowing it to perceive the world in 3D and recognise individuals. The 177-cm tall robot will cost somewhere between ₹71 lakh and ₹82 lakh.

235.title: I have no aspirations of becoming Opposition's PM face in 2024: Nitish Kumar
235.article_body: After being sworn in as Bihar Chief Minister for a record eighth time, Janata Dal (United) leader Nitish Kumar on Friday said that he has no aspirations of becoming the Opposition's PM face in 2024. "I will make an effort to see that all the Opposition parties work together. If they do, it will be good," he said.

236.title: Tried giving Civil Services Exam many times but kept on failing: Big B
236.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said he tried giving the Civil Services Exam "many times" after college but kept on "failing". Discussing his struggle, Amitabh had earlier stated, "There was a lot of rejection because everywhere I went, I failed to get a job...I was either not qualified enough or I was too shy." "[It was] terribly frustrating," he'd added.

237.title: End military activities at Europe's largest nuclear plant in Ukraine: UN
237.article_body: The UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres called for an immediate end to all military activity around Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine, as Moscow and Kyiv blamed each other for renewed shelling. Guterres warned that any damage could lead to "catastrophic consequences" in the region and beyond. He called for a demilitarised zone to be established around the Zaporizhzhia plant.

238.title: Avoid large gatherings during I-Day amid COVID surge: Centre to states
238.article_body: Amid surge in COVID-19 cases across the country, the central government has asked states to ensure there are no large gatherings for Independence Day celebrations. "It's imperative that Covid guidelines are followed," Centre said. Further, the Home Ministry has asked all states and Union Territories to carry out a 'Swachh Bharat' campaign at a key location in each district.

239.title: 24-yr-old man swept away in Indore drain, body found 150 metres from site
239.article_body: The body of a 24-year-old man who was swept away in a swollen drain in Madhya Pradesh's Indore was found on Thursday. The man, Zakir Khan, had accidentally fallen into the swollen drain on Wednesday when he was trying to stop other people from entering the water body. Khan's body was found about 150 metres away from the site.

240.title: The box office start has sent shockwaves: Girish on 'Laal...', 'Raksha...'
240.article_body: Girish Johar, who is a co-producer of Aishwarya Rai Bachchan-starrer 'Jazbaa', said the box office start of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' has sent "shockwaves". "Imagine that Aamir Khan coming after four years and Akshay Kumar...combined are not even clocking ₹20 crore on a big holiday release," added Girish. "No one wants to watch [a] bad film," he stated.

241.title: UP CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for families of those killed in Banda boat mishap
241.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday announced ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each for families of people who died in boat mishap in Banda. The Chief Minister has also given instructions for immediate help and relief to the victims and proper treatment to those injured in the accident. The boat capsized due to strong winds, police had earlier said.

242.title: 2,000 live cartridges recovered in Delhi ahead of Independence Day; 6 arrested
242.article_body: As many as 2,000 live cartridges have been recovered in Delhi ahead of Independence Day and six persons have been arrested, police said. The accused were arrested from the Anand Vihar area in the national capital with two bags of cartridges. Those arrested are being questioned about where the 2,000 live cartridges were to be supplied, police added.

243.title: Boulders fall on railway tracks on Mumbai-Pune line; trains delayed
243.article_body: A few trains were delayed after boulders and muck fell on the railway tracks between the Nagnath-Palasdhari section and the Lonavala-Karjat Ghat section on the Mumbai-Pune line around 12.50 am on Friday, railway officials said. The boulders, that fell on the Up-line which goes towards Mumbai, were removed by 8.15 am after which services were restored, officials added.

244.title: Light to moderate rainfall in Pune till August 15, no warnings: IMD
244.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted light to moderate rains in Pune and isolated heavy rains in ghat regions for Friday. From August 13 to August 15, light rains are very likely in Pune, it added. IMD released no warnings for Pune and ghat regions from Friday onwards. "The monsoon trough...oscillates around its normal position till August 16," an official said.

245.title: Shapoorji Pallonji to offload 1.25% stake in Sterling and Wilson
245.article_body: Shapoorji Pallonji And Company Private Limited has proposed to offload its 1.25% stake, which comprises up to 23,70,787 equity shares, in Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy Limited (SWREL). The floor price of the offer shall be ₹270 per equity share of the company, SWREL said. The offer for sale (OFS) will take place on Friday for non-retail investors.

246.title: Dwayne Bravo creates history, becomes 1st bowler to take 600 wickets in T20 cricket
246.article_body: West Indian all-rounder Dwayne Bravo has created history by becoming the first bowler to take 600 wickets in T20 cricket. The 38-year-old reached the 600-wicket mark after picking up two wickets for Northern Superchargers against Oval Invincibles in The Hundred on Thursday. He reached 600 wickets in 516 T20 innings.

247.title: 3 schoolgirls kidnapped, raped in Delhi; 2 women among those arrested
247.article_body: Three schoolgirls were kidnapped and raped after being given beverages laced with sedatives in Delhi's Rohini, police said on Thursday. Four people, including two women, have been arrested in connection with this case, police added. Girls said that one of the accused took them to a house where they were kept hostage and raped.

248.title: 2 from B'desh arrested for using drone near Kolkata's Victoria Memorial
248.article_body: Two Bangladeshi nationals were arrested for allegedly using a drone near Kolkata's Victoria Memorial Hall on Wednesday, police said. The accused were reportedly taking pictures of the memorial and its surrounding areas without any permission. "Flying drones in and around the Victoria Memorial Hall is prohibited as it's a no-drone zone and...falls in the defence area," an official said.

249.title: SC sets August 28 as new deadline for Noida twin towers demolition
249.article_body: Supreme Court has given an additional time of one week for the demolition of Supertech's twin 40-storey towers in Uttar Pradesh's Noida. The demolition, which was scheduled for August 21, will now take place on August 28. SC has also granted a seven-day buffer, from August 29 to September 4, in case of any "technical glitches or weather-related problems".

250.title: Taliban cleric who supported female education killed by bomb hidden in artificial limb
250.article_body: A prominent Afghan cleric who supported the Taliban and was in favour of female education has been killed. Sheikh Rahimullah Haqqani was targeted by a man who detonated explosives hidden in an artificial plastic limb, Reuters said quoting Taliban sources. The Islamic State (IS) group claimed responsibility for the bombing saying it happened inside his office.

251.title: It's a sad loss: Mumbai chief selector on Arjun Tendulkar playing for Goa
251.article_body: Mumbai chief selector Salil Ankola has termed Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun Tendulkar's decision to represent Goa as a "sad loss for Mumbai cricket". "He wasn't getting many opportunities in Mumbai because there were already a set of fast bowlers playing...I am sure Goa is going to gain a lot out of him," added Ankola. "Arjun works very hard," he stated.

252.title: Govt shares pics of man wiping metro floor after co-passenger drops food; praises him
252.article_body: The government has shared pictures of a man wiping the floor of a metro train. "Here's a citizen who walks the talk of #Swachhata. Pranjal Dubey showed the true meaning of #JanBhagidari by picking up the food spilled on the floor by a co-passenger & wiping the floor with his handkerchief," it tweeted.

253.title: My kiss in 'Darlings' took me by surprise, it's a sweet, delicate moment: Shefali
253.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said that her kiss scene in 'Darlings' took her by surprise, adding that it was a sweet and delicate moment. "I thought, 'Hain, ye kya ho gaya (Wow, what just happened)," she said. "One of the shots we did...I ran to kiss him and [my] bag hit my face and we both kissed the bag," Shefali added.

254.title: Woman asks Delhi HC to stop 48-yr-old Noida man's trip to Europe for euthanasia
254.article_body: A Bengaluru-based woman has moved Delhi High Court, asking it to stop her 48-year-old Noida-based friend with Chronic Fatigue Syndrome from travelling to Europe allegedly to undergo euthanasia. The plea stated that he's bed bound and just able to walk a few steps. The woman pleaded that his parents would suffer "irreparable loss" and "hardship" if his trip isn't halted.

255.title: Avinash used to be so lazy, he would eat vada pav daily, jokes brother
255.article_body: Talking about Avinash Sable, who is the first Indian athlete to win a medal in 3,000m steeplechase event at CWG, having bagged silver at CWG 2022, his brother Yogesh jokingly said Avinash used to be "very lazy". Yogesh added that Avinash would eat vada pav daily after college. "He had put on so much [weight]," stated their father Mukund.

256.title: Odisha govt to distribute 30 lakh National Flags for free
256.article_body: The Odisha government will distribute 30 lakh National Flags for free ahead of Independence Day. "There is great enthusiasm among the people of the country to mark the occasion, extensive preparations are being made for this at the government and private levels," the official statement read. The 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign will be held from August 13 to 15.

257.title: Aryan Khan's debut web show to be satire on film industry: Report
257.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan is working on his debut web show which will be a satire on the film industry, reported PeepingMoon. As per the report, Aryan will serve as the showrunner but might not direct it. He is reportedly working with a team of writers at Red Chillies Entertainment and will take it on floors in 2023.

258.title: Russian reporter who called Putin a 'killer' put under house arrest
258.article_body: A Russian court on Thursday placed former state TV journalist Marina Ovsyannikova under house arrest for nearly two months, pending an investigation on charges of spreading false information about Russia's armed forces. Marina Ovsyannikova was charged over a street protest last month when she held up a banner calling Russian President Vladimir Putin a "killer" and his soldiers "fascists".

259.title: Valuations of US startups seeking early-stage funding contract
259.article_body: US startups seeking early-stage funding have seen a decline in valuations in Q2 as investors become more cautious. Investors are urging founders to make more concessions, as last year's easy fiscal policies and stimulus measures that led to an investment frenzy are fading away. Median pre-money valuation for early-stage funding rounds was down 16% from Q1, as per a report.

260.title: French Air Force contingent makes stopover at IAF's Sulur base
260.article_body: As part of a mega military operation, a French Air and Space Force contingent, which included three Rafale jets, made a stopover at the Indian Air Force's Sulur station in Tamil Nadu. A French readout said that the cooperation with the IAF demonstrated a high level of mutual trust and interoperability between the two sides.

261.title: Man tries to drown woman in public fountain in Spain; pics show 2 men saving her
261.article_body: A woman was rescued by two bystanders after a man appeared to be forcing her head down into a public fountain in broad daylight in Spain's Valencia. Pictures and video of the incident have surfaced online, showing two men jumping inside the fountain before punching and hitting the man to save the woman.

262.title: Johnson & Johnson to stop selling talc-based baby powder after 38,000 cancer lawsuits
262.article_body: Johnson & Johnson has announced that it will stop making and selling its talc-based baby powder around the world from next year. The company will transition to an all cornstarch-based baby powder portfolio, which is already sold worldwide. Johnson & Johnson faces 38,000 lawsuits from consumers and their survivors claiming its talc products caused cancer due to contamination with asbestos.

263.title: There are concerns over Shaheen's fitness, hope he'll play Asia Cup: Babar
263.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said there are "concerns" over pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi's fitness, adding that he hopes Shaheen will play in the Asia Cup 2022. "We are trying to ensure he can get ready as soon as possible," added Babar. Team India pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Harshal Patel are not available for the tournament due to injuries.

264.title: Massive fire breaks out at hotel near Gujarat's Jamnagar, 27 rescued
264.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a five-storey hotel near Gujarat's Jamnagar on Thursday and 27 people were rescued, police said. "The fire started around 7.30 pm...27 guests were staying in 18 of the total 36 rooms. They were all rescued...Hotel staff too is safe," police added. The fire was brought under control around 10.30 pm, police stated.

265.title: Delhi AQI to be 'satisfactory', city to witness 'moderate temperature'
265.article_body: System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research on Thursday said that Delhi will witness "moderate temperature" in coming days. "For...next 3 days...AQI is likely to be within 'satisfactory' or 'lower end of moderate' due to expected light rain/drizzle spells. Moderate temperature (~ 34-35 deg C) and mixing layer height (~ 2.0) [to] maintain moderate ventilation," the agency said.

266.title: Bengaluru CCB arrests 2 serial extortioners, seizes ₹78 lakh-phones
266.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of the Bengaluru City Police has arrested two serial extortioners who were wanted in several cases of mobile phone thefts, the police tweeted on Thursday. The police said that 512 smartphones worth ₹78 lakh have also been seized. The accused used to sell the extorted mobile phones in Mumbai, Hyderabad and Delhi, the police added.

267.title: 4 female, 3 male students suspended over 'inappropriate act' in Assam classroom
267.article_body: A college in Assam has suspended seven students after a video showing them engaging in an "inappropriate act" in a classroom surfaced on social media. Principal of the college said, "The students did this turpitude act in tiffin hours when no teachers were present." Four of the seven students are female, and three are male.

268.title: Dabur India Chairman Amit Burman resigns
268.article_body: Dabur India on Friday announced that the board has accepted Chairman Amit Burman's resignation with effect from August 10, 2022. Burman will continue to serve as the Non-Executive Director for the company. When Dabur Foods forayed into the processed food industry in 1999, Burman took over as the CEO. In 2019, he took charge as the Chairman of Dabur India.

269.title: Search operation resumes for 17 missing people as boat capsizes in UP
269.article_body: Teams of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) resumed search operation this morning for 17 missing people after their boat capsized in the Yamuna river in UP's Banda district. The boat was carrying 30 to 40 people and was going from Fatehpur to Marka village. Three bodies have been recovered till now.

270.title: Punjab Assembly Speaker's security staff assault truck driver; he apologises
270.article_body: Punjab Assembly Speaker Kultar Singh Sandhwan's security personnel allegedly brutally thrashed a truck driver after the truck rammed into Sandhwan's car on the Amritsar-Jalandhar bypass road on Thursday. A purported video of the incident has surfaced online. Sandhwan, who escaped unhurt, later said that his security staff had argued with the truck driver and apologised for it.

271.title: Akshay's 'Raksha Bandhan' opens at ₹7.5 cr, his worst opening of 2022
271.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar's third film of 2022 'Raksha Bandhan' collected ₹7.5 crore on its opening day making it his worst opening of the year. His earlier films 'Bachchhan Paandey' and 'Samrat Prithviraj' had earned ₹13.2 crore and ₹10.7 crore on their opening days, respectively. 'Raksha Bandhan' clashed with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' which collected ₹10.75 crore at its opening.

272.title: BMTC to offer free bus rides on all routes on Independence Day
272.article_body: Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC), in order to mark its 25 years, has decided to give free bus services on all routes on Independence Day. The service will cover all ordinary, AC and special Volvo buses run by BMTC. Further, on August 16, the corporation will present medals to drivers who haven't been involved in any accidents during their service.

273.title: A must-watch, joyful ride: Rajkummar Rao on 'Laal Singh Chaddha'
273.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao on Thursday took to Instagram Stories to appreciate Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The actor wrote, "'Laal Singh Chaddha' is a [must-watch]. Such a beautiful film. What a joyful emotional ride...And the most wonderful surprise cameo ever." The Advait Chandan directorial features a special appearance by actor Shah Rukh Khan.

274.title: Car falls into river under bridge in Pune; 5 of family rescued
274.article_body: The fire brigade rescued five members of a family, including two children, after their car fell into the river under Pune's SM Joshi Bridge on Friday. The firemen rescued the family using ropes, life jackets and other equipment. The car was washed away by the river's current, which had apparently strengthened after water was released from a dam.

275.title: Elon Musk responds after Ford CEO mocks him over Tesla's delayed EV truck
275.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has responded after Ford CEO Jim Farley mocked the electric car company over its delayed release of Cybertruck and called Ford's F-150 Lightning the "leader of all EV pickup trucks" in the United States. "Take that, Elon Musk," Farley further said during an event. Responding to this, Musk said, "Thanks, but I already have one."

276.title: UP govt to induct 100 youths under CM fellowship programme for governance
276.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government is planning to recruit about 100 youths under its Chief Minister fellowship programme for governance. The government has invited applications to appoint one research scholar for each of the 100 backward blocks of the state to work on policymaking, research and development. A budget of ₹5.58 crore has been allotted for the programme in first year.

277.title: 31 injured after 2 rollercoaster trains collide at Legoland in Germany
277.article_body: At least 31 people were injured after two rollercoaster trains collided at Legoland's theme park in Germany on Thursday. Three helicopters were deployed to the scene. People reportedly had to be carried down from a height of at least 16 feet. Last week, a 57-year-old woman died after falling from a moving rollercoaster in an amusement park in Germany's Klotten.

278.title: Woman beaten, clothes forcibly removed in Madhya Pradesh; 4 arrested
278.article_body: Police arrested four persons after a woman was beaten and her clothes were forcibly removed in Madhya Pradesh's Jhabua. This comes after she returned to her husband whom she had left eight months ago and went to live with her partner. The incident took place when the woman's partner came to her village to take her back with him.

279.title: Aditya Birla Health Insurance to get ₹665 cr investment from ADIA
279.article_body: The boards of Aditya Birla Capital and Aditya Birla Health Insurance have approved a proposal to infuse ₹665 crore capital into the health insurer from an Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) subsidiary. ADIA will hold 9.99% stake in Aditya Birla Health Insurance, while Aditya Birla Capital and South Africa-based Momentum Metropolitan Holdings will own a 45.91% and 44.10% stake, respectively.

280.title: Barcelona's Aubameyang picks Lionel Messi over Cristiano Ronaldo
280.article_body: Barcelona striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang picked Lionel Messi over Manchester United's Cristiano Ronaldo when asked to choose between the two during an interview. Aubameyang further went on to select arch-rivals Real Madrid over Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur. Responding to a query over the player he will pick between Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer, Aubameyang named Nadal.

281.title: Vigilance agency raids 26 premises of former TN CM Palaniswami's aide
281.article_body: The Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption conducted raids at 26 premises of former AIADMK MLA, KPP Baskar, and his family in connection with a disproportionate assets case. Baskar is a close aide of former Tamil Nadu CM and AIADMK's interim General Secretary Edappadi Palaniswami. The agency claimed that Baskar's assets were disproportionate to that of his income by ₹4.72 crore.

282.title: Actor Alec Baldwin's wife responds to rumours that her baby bump is fake
282.article_body: Actor Alec Baldwin's wife Hilaria has responded to rumours that her baby bump is fake. "My friends made a good point about my belly. It kind of looks like a fake...like I ate a ball...I guess the psycho conspiracy theorists online with way too much time on their hands have somewhat of a point here," she wrote on Instagram.

283.title: Samsung's billionaire heir jailed for bribery gets presidential pardon in S Korea
283.article_body: Samsung's billionaire heir Lee Jae-yong, who was sentenced to jail last year over bribery and embezzlement, received a presidential pardon in South Korea on Friday. The country's minister Han Dong-hoon said Lee Jae-yong will be "reinstated" to give him a chance to "contribute to overcoming the economic crisis". He was released on parole in August last year.

284.title: Armed man tries to enter FBI office in Ohio, shot dead in standoff
284.article_body: An armed man was killed after he tried to "breach" an FBI building in Cincinnati, Ohio, on Thursday, officials said. The man had fled the scene after the attempted breach and was shot dead following a car chase, gun battle and a standoff in a rural area, they added. Authorities are probing if he'd ties to the far-right extremist groups.

285.title: Driver carrying cargo to UP finds over 15 feet long python under truck seat
285.article_body: A driver who was carrying cargo from Madhya Pradesh to Uttar Pradesh in his truck found a 15 feet long python curled up under his seat, reports said. The driver felt some movement under his seat when he stopped for a meal. He alerted people around him and a forest team was called in to get the reptile out.

286.title: India reports 16,561 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,23,535
286.article_body: India has reported 16,561 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,299 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,23,535, while the death toll has risen to 5,26,928, according to the latest data.

287.title: Aamir's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' opens at ₹10.75 cr, his lowest in 13 years
287.article_body: Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' collected ₹10.75 crore on its opening day, as per Box Office India. This is the actor's lowest opening in the last 13 years. His 2018 film 'Thugs of Hindostan' had opened at ₹52 crore. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' recorded the third biggest opening for a Hindi film in 2022 after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Bachchhan Paandey'.

288.title: Wish 'Samrat Prithviraj' worked, but we have to accept failures: Sonu Sood
288.article_body: Speaking about the box office failure of 'Samrat Prithviraj', actor Sonu Sood said that he wishes the film had done well, adding that it is one of the special films of his career. "You have to accept your failures and learn from them and next time you can be better, you can deliver better," the actor added.

289.title: 20-year-old woman afraid of failing CA examination kills self in Nagpur
289.article_body: A 20-year-old woman, who was preparing for Chartered Accountancy (CA) examination, allegedly died by suicide, fearing failure. The incident took place in wee hours of Wednesday, an official said. The official further said that the woman had, before taking the step, messaged her mother and other family members, stating that she was scared of failing the exam.

290.title: Shah Rukh Khan to play Vanar Astra in 'Brahmāstra', pics leaked
290.article_body: Pictures and videos have surfaced on social media showing actor Shah Rukh Khan as Vanar Astra in Ayan Mukerji's upcoming film 'Brahmāstra'. The film, which is part one of a trilogy, features Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, Amitabh Bachchan and Mouni Roy. Shah Rukh recently made cameo appearances in Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'.

291.title: Bring back Congress for completion of projects in Raj: Gehlot urges people
291.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday urged people to vote for Congress in the next state Assembly polls, saying his government's ouster will stall ongoing development projects. Gehlot said the Barmer refinery project was delayed as Congress was ousted from power in 2014. "Only if our government is repeated, we would be able to complete ongoing projects," Gehlot added.

292.title: Axar has stronger claim than Jadeja as pure bowler: Manjrekar on T20 WC
292.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said Axar Patel and Ravichandran Ashwin have a "stronger" claim than Ravindra Jadeja, considering the role of a pure bowler, in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022. "Jadeja isn't somebody you can go to in...first six overs whereas you can with Axar," added Manjrekar. "Jadeja...knows there is some serious competition coming in," he stated.

293.title: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar's reappointment opposed by advisory firm
293.article_body: The Institutional Investor Advisory Services India (IiAS) has advised shareholders to vote against the reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Paytm parent One97 Communications. It has also opposed his remuneration. The advisory firm said it believes "the board must consider professionalising the management” as Sharma's "commitments" haven't played out.

294.title: Sensex falls 68 points, Nifty at 17,639 in opening trade
294.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in red on Friday with Sensex and Nifty falling 68.30 points and 19.20 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 59,264.30 points and Nifty at 17,639.80. ONGC, IndusInd Bank, Titan Company, ICICI Bank and Hindalco were among the major Nifty gainers, while Apollo Hospitals, Tata Motors, Tech Mahindra, Infosys and Wipro slipped.

295.title: Migrant labourer from Bihar shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Bandipora
295.article_body: A migrant labourer from Bihar's Madhepura, identified as Mohd Amrez, was shot dead by terrorists on Thursday at Soadnara Sumbal in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora. "During the intervening night, terrorists fired upon Mohd Amrez...He was shifted to a hospital...where he succumbed," police said. "We thought he went to toilet...saw him lying in a pool of blood," the deceased's brother said.

296.title: Trump's Florida home raided by FBI in search of nuclear documents: Report
296.article_body: The FBI agents were looking for documents relating to nuclear weapons when they raided former US President Donald Trump's home in Florida this week, The Washington Post has reported. However, it was unclear if such documents were recovered at Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort. On Thursday, the Justice Department lawyers filed a motion seeking to unseal the search warrant in the case.

297.title: It was a dummy plane: Influencer Bobby Kataria after smoking video goes viral
297.article_body: After a video of Bobby Kataria smoking inside a plane went viral on social media, the influencer said that the video was shot in a dummy plane that was a part of his shooting. "How can a lighter make its way into an airplane?" he said. Meanwhile, SpiceJet said the video was shot on January 20, 2022.

298.title: Within 4 mins, robbers loot ₹13 lakh from bank in Punjab; probe on
298.article_body: A probe has been initiated after five armed robbers stole ₹13 lakh from a branch of the Punjab National Bank in a village in Punjab's Ludhiana before escaping within four minutes on Thursday. The bank had no security guard. The accused also took bank employees' phones so that they couldn't inform the police, which the former threw away before escaping.

299.title: Yen falls the most against US dollar as markets rethink Fed move
299.article_body: With markets expecting the US Federal Reserve to do much more to contain inflation, the Japanese yen fell the most against the US dollar on Friday. On Thursday, the dollar index rose 0.1% to 105.210, while the yen fell 0.12% to 133.19 per dollar. The sterling traded down 0.23% at $1.21 and the euro fell to $1.03 against the dollar.

300.title: May not be qualified enough: Pankaja Munde on not being in Maha cabinet
300.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party leader Pankaja Munde said that she "may not be qualified enough" to be inducted into the Maharashtra cabinet. "Whoever is eligible according to them will be inducted into the cabinet. I have no stand about it. I try to do my politics by maintaining my pride," Munde added after expansion of the cabinet.

301.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning in several states; list released
301.article_body: IMD has predicted isolated very heavy rainfall in Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh and Odisha between August 13 and 15. Heavy rainfall is likely over West Bengal, Jharkhand, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura between August 12 and 15. Isolated heavy falls are also likely over Karnataka, J&K, Himachal Pradesh, coastal Andhra Pradesh and Uttarakhand.

302.title: It is my best film, has made me 'cry' so much: Akshay on 'Raksha...'
302.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said 'Raksha Bandhan' is the "best" film of his career, adding that the movie has made him "cry so much". "I'm not someone who cries watching films," added Akshay. The film's director Aanand L Rai stated he had to unlearn a lot of things to make the film. "I had to lose all my smartness," added Aanand.

303.title: Doubting wife's character, auto driver kills her using spade in Rajasthan
303.article_body: Doubting his wife's character, a 30-year-old autorickshaw driver killed his 25-year-old wife using a spade in Rajasthan. The accused was arrested and confessed to his crime. Police said the relatives of the woman have registered a case of murder against 11 people as they suspect involvement of others in the murder. A case has been registered against all.

304.title: I don't have time for people venting: Kareena on not using Twitter
304.article_body: Speaking about not being a Twitter user, actress Kareena Kapoor stated that she feels like the social media platform is for people who "just want to keep venting". She further said that celebrities are trolled on Twitter every other day amid cancel culture. "That's why I'm not on Twitter...I don't have time for that," the actress stated.

305.title: CISF holds Tiranga bike rally in Hyderabad
305.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) on Thursday held a Tiranga bike rally in Hyderabad. National Flags were also distributed among commuters to support the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "All CISF personnel inclusive of all ranks carried out a bike rally holding Tricolours in their hands in city side area of Hyderabad airport," an official statement said.

306.title: US Justice Dept seeks to unseal search warrant of Trump’s home
306.article_body: The US Justice Department is asking a court to unseal the warrant that let FBI agents search ex-President Donald Trump's Florida home. If granted, the documents would be available to the public. Monday's FBI search of Trump's Mar-a-Lago property is believed to be connected to an investigation into whether he removed classified records and sensitive material from the White House.

307.title: 6 killed after Congress MLA's son-in-law rams SUV into bike, rickshaw in Gujarat
307.article_body: At least six persons, including three women, died in an accident that took place between a car, bike and an auto-rickshaw on Thursday at around 7 pm in Gujarat's Anand, police said. Khetan Padhiyar, the son-in-law of Congress MLA Punambhai Madhabhai Parmar from Sojitra, allegedly rammed his SUV into the bike and auto-rickshaw. Khetan has been arrested, police added.

308.title: 6-yr-old girl kidnapped from Pune bus depot, rescued within 12 hrs
308.article_body: Pune police have rescued a six-year-old girl who was kidnapped from the Swargate bus depot within 12 hours. Two women were arrested for allegedly abducting the girl due to an ongoing financial dispute between their family and the girl's family, a senior police inspector said. "Our team rescued the girl from Solapur on Wednesday evening," the senior police inspector added.

309.title: Man sentenced to 20 yrs in jail for sexually assaulting minor in Hyd
309.article_body: A Hyderabad court on Thursday sentenced a man to 20 years of imprisonment for sexually assaulting an eight-year-old girl in 2015. According to reports, the victim's parents worked at a college and lived on campus with their two children. On August 26, when the girl's parents left the room, the accused reportedly took her to nearby bushes and assaulted her.

310.title: Went to Sonam's bully, felt it'd be like SRK in Josh; got socked in eye: Arjun
310.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said he got "black eye" after he went to actress Sonam Kapoor's bully in school. Arjun said he asked the bully how can he talk to Sonam in a certain way, adding that he imagined it would be like Shah Rukh Khan in 'Josh' where two gangs fight, but he just got "socked in the eye".

311.title: Don't reveal our military tactics against Russia: Zelenskyy to officials
311.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has told officials to stop talking to journalists about the country's military tactics against Russia, saying such remarks are "frankly irresponsible". "War is definitely not the time for vanity and loud statements. The fewer details you divulge about our defence plans, the better it will be for the implementation of those defence plans," Zelenskyy said.

312.title: Pune's weekly COVID positivity rate reaches 12.14%; 2nd highest in Maha
312.article_body: Pune's weekly COVID-19 positivity rate has reached 12.14%, the second highest in Maharashtra, officials said. "While districts like Pune and Mumbai reported a surge in COVID-19 cases, other districts did not. Now the cases in these districts see a decline, other districts are reporting a surge," an official said. Gondia district reported the highest weekly COVID-19 positivity rate at 12.37%.

313.title: 2 of family die, 2 injured as recently purchased AC explodes in Mumbai
313.article_body: Two members of a family were killed while two others were critically injured after an AC that was recently purchased by the family exploded in Mumbai. The blast, reports said, caused a level one fire. A neighbour said that the fire broke out while the family was sleeping. Laxmi Rathod and her daughter Madhu were killed in the incident.

314.title: Cook dies of snake bite at Hyderabad's Osmania University campus
314.article_body: A 45-yr-old cook died due to snake bite at Hyderabad's Osmania University campus on Wednesday night. The incident occurred when the woman, identified as Kavita, was working in the kitchen at Manjeera hostel. Kavita was rushed to Gandhi Hospital where she died during treatment, police said. Following the incident, students and employees demanded adequate steps against the problem.

315.title: Seats are filling fast for IIM Indore’s IPBA program : UNext Jigsaw
315.article_body: IIM Indore and UNext Jigsaw announced that very few seats remain for 14th batch of their online Integrated program in Business Analytics (IPBA) which covers subjects with 10+ graded assignments, industry-relevant case studies and capstone project. Moreover, 83% alums boosted their career with 48% average salary hike, it revealed. With IIM alum status, get access to its campus and library.

316.title: Google asks Apple to fix texting, says 'green bubbles make chats difficult to read'
316.article_body: Google has launched a campaign to pressure Apple into adopting RCS, a next-generation standard for text messaging. Google has asked Apple to "fix texting" between iPhone and Android devices, citing blurry videos, missing read receipts, and no texting over Wi-Fi. It has criticised the green-coloured bubbles for chats on iPhones with Android devices, saying it makes texts difficult to read.

317.title: I rejected Saif's marriage proposal twice before agreeing: Kareena
317.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor said she rejected husband and actor Saif Ali Khan's marriage proposal twice before agreeing. "He told me that in Greece and...in Ladakh...At that time, I was like, 'I don't know because I don't know you'...It was more like an 'I want to know you better'," added Kareena. "What's important is that finally I said yes," she stated.

318.title: B'luru AC bus fleet more than halved due to WFH, rising fuel costs
318.article_body: Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has reduced its AC bus fleet to 373 from 834 amid a lack of demand as many IT professionals are choosing to work from home (WFH), a BMTC official said. The official added that IT professionals use 90% of these buses. Rising fuel costs and operational charges are also a factor, another BMTC official stated.

319.title: Delhi LG orders FIR against 11 ex-DDA officials in 9-yr-old corruption case
319.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena has ordered the registration of FIRs against 11 former Delhi Development Authority (DDA) officials in a 2013 corruption case. The case pertains to the upgradation and beautification of Kingsway Camp's Coronation Park, the tender cost of which was ₹14.24 crore but additional work amounting to ₹114.83 crore was also carried out without any sanctions.

320.title: Water seen dripping on seats inside SpiceJet flight from Mumbai; video surfaces
320.article_body: A video showing water dripping on seats inside Mumbai-Jabalpur SpiceJet flight is being widely circulated online. Passengers said they were given different seats after complaining about water leakage, however, one of them still had water dripping in front of his seat. The passenger said he would complain about the matter to the Civil Aviation Ministry.

321.title: 3 men fire at Mumbai's Gazebo Market, threaten to kill stall vendors
321.article_body: Three men on a bike fired three rounds at the Gazebo Market on Linking Road in Mumbai's Bandra West. The incident took place on Thursday night. Reports said that the bikers also threatened to kill all those who had put up stalls in the area. Police reportedly said they suspect that people from the land mafia might be behind firing.

322.title: Asia's richest man Adani gets Z category security after intel flags threat: Report
322.article_body: Asia's richest man and Adani Group's 60-year-old Chairman Gautam Adani has been given Z category security cover from the central government, a report said. The decision is said to have been taken on the basis of a threat perception report by the Intelligence Bureau. Adani, who has a fortune of $126 billion, will reportedly bear the expenses for the security.

323.title: Car thief caught hiding inside giant 'breathing' teddy bear in UK; pics go viral
323.article_body: A man in the United Kingdom who was wanted for car theft was sent to jail on Friday after police found him hiding inside a giant teddy bear. Joshua Dobson, 18, had been wanted by the police since May. "Our officers noticed a large bear breathing in the address," the Greater Manchester Police wrote in a post on Facebook.

324.title: Urvashi responds after Pant says 'Leave me alone, sister'; calls him 'cougar hunter'
324.article_body: After cricketer Rishabh Pant seemingly responded to actress Urvashi Rautela's recent viral interview wherein she talked about a person named 'RP', Urvashi Rautela reacted via an Instagram post. "Chotu bhaiyaa should play bat ball," she wrote while adding #cougarhunter. Pant had written 'Leave me alone, sister' while seemingly responding to Urvashi's remark that 'RP' wanted to meet her in Delhi.

325.title: Could've finished Darlings scene early but Alia, Shefali kept laughing: Jasmeet
325.article_body: 'Darlings' director Jasmeet K Reen said that the team could have finished filming a scene three-four hours earlier but actresses Shefali Shah and Alia Bhatt kept laughing. "They would say half line and they would just keep laughing...They have that kind of energy on set...They're so into it, and positive and fun...that sometimes they are just cracking up," Jasmeet said.

326.title: Man claims to be James Bond from UK, cheats Mumbai woman of ₹5.07 lakh
326.article_body: A 27-year-old woman from Mumbai was cheated of ₹5.07 lakh by cyber frauds, who posed as a businessman from the UK and identified himself as 'James Bond'. Police said that the accused sent a parcel full of expensive gifts to India, following which they posed as government officials and made the victim deposit ₹5.07 lakh in various accounts.

327.title: 25-yr-old Bihar woman police constable found dead in Pune hotel room
327.article_body: A 25-year-old woman police constable from Bihar, who was in Pune as part of an investigation, was found dead in a hotel room on Thursday afternoon. A senior police officer said that while the preliminary probe points to suicide, senior officials from Pimpri Chinchwad and Muzaffarpur were coordinating with each other to investigate the cause of the death.

328.title: Maternal uncle allegedly rapes 16-year-old girl in Gurugram
328.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her maternal uncle in Gurugram, police said on Thursday. According to the girl's complaint, her uncle called her to his home in Bhondsi area, where he lives with his wife and son, to learn sewing on July 10. He raped the girl on July 28 and August 7, police said citing the complaint.

329.title: Inter-state human trafficking racket busted in Navi Mumbai; 17 rescued
329.article_body: Mumbai Police recently busted an inter-state human trafficking racket running in four Navi Mumbai flats and rescued 17 women hailing from West Bengal, Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh who were forced into prostitution. Police has arrested nine people and are looking for two main accused. The incident came to light after a 24-year-old woman managed to flee from the flat.

330.title: 27-yr-old Mumbai woman tries buying whiskey online, loses ₹5.35 lakh
330.article_body: A 27-year-old woman from Mumbai lost ₹5.35 lakh to frauds, who posed as wine shop executives and cheated her on the pretext of delivering a bottle of whiskey to her house. The accused also convinced the woman to increase her debit card limit that helped them withdraw ₹5.35 lakh from her account till Wednesday noon, a police official said.

331.title: Court acquits Mumbai man in rash driving case due to poor road condition
331.article_body: A 61-year-old man in Mumbai was acquitted in a rash driving case after the court noted that it appears it wasn't the accused's fault as the road at the accident site was dug up. The court noted that it's not sufficient to prove the accident took place by accused's vehicle. The victim had suffered a broken leg and ankle.

332.title: Pet pitbull dog attacks, seriously injures 35-yr-old house help in Gurugram
332.article_body: A pet pitbull dog allegedly attacked and seriously injured a 35-year-old house help who was on her way to work in Gurugram's Civil Lines area on Thursday morning. A police officer, requesting anonymity, said preliminary probe has found that the dog attacked her from behind and bit into her neck. The dog let her go after intervention from a passerby.

333.title: Australia cricketers donate tour prize money to children, families in crisis-hit SL
333.article_body: Australian men's cricket team players donated their prize money from the recent all-format tour of Sri Lanka to support children and families impacted by Sri Lanka's economic crisis. In all, the team donated AU$45,000 to UNICEF Australia's Sri Lanka appeal. "It was very clear to us how much day-to-day life for Sri Lankans is being impacted," Pat Cummins said.

334.title: Satellite photographs indicate serious damage to Crimea air base
334.article_body: Commercially available satellite photographs taken before and after purported explosions in Crimea's Saki air base earlier this week show heavy damage sustained by the station. Earlier, Russia, which controls Crimea, denied any attack in the peninsula and rubbished reports of any damage to its aircraft. Ukraine has claimed nine Russian aircraft were destroyed in Crimea.

335.title: Mohali Police arrest 2 for extorting businessmen in the district
335.article_body: Mohali Police have arrested two people who were involved in extorting businessmen in the district. The accused were members of a gang and were already wanted for firing outside a nightclub in March. According to Mohali Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Vivek Sheel Soni, the arrested would scare businessmen by firing outside their homes or offices to get money extorted.

336.title: Sitabuldi Fort to open as part of Independence Day celebrations
336.article_body: The Indian Army will open the Sitabuldi Fort as part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' to commemorate 75 years of India's independence. A symbol of military heritage, the fort is controlled by the Indian Army. It is only opened to the general public on specific days and this year, as an exception, will be open for two days.

337.title: British Instagrammer asked to leave Sri Lanka after she backed protesters
337.article_body: A British woman Instagrammer who was in Sri Lanka has been asked by authorities to leave the country before August 15 for participating in anti-government protests. Officials seized Kayleigh Fraser's passport to check if she had violated any of the visa conditions while staying in the crisis-hit country. Fraser had posted images and videos of the recent 'GotaGoHome' protest campaign.

338.title: BJP will be uprooted in 2024, will lose 40 LS seats in 3 states: JD(U)
338.article_body: Janata Dal (United) National President Lalan Singh on Thursday stated that BJP will be uprooted from power at the Centre in 2024. He added that BJP will lose 40 Lok Sabha seats out of its 2019 winning tally in three states — Bihar, Jharkhand and West Bengal. Singh made the remarks after meeting RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav.

339.title: Nykaa's CEO of private label division Reena Chhabra quits
339.article_body: In a regulatory filing, Nykaa said that the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of its private label division FSN Brands, Reena Chhabra, has resigned, with effect from August 16. Earlier, she worked with cosmetic brand Colorbar as their COO and joined Nykaa in 2016. According to the draft red herring prospectus, she was paid a total of ₹3.06 crore in FY21.

340.title: BankBazaar.com to raise $100 mn in 3 years: CEO Adhil Shetty
340.article_body: BankBazaar.com is looking to raise $100 million in the next three years to aid the company's accelerating business practices, Founder and CEO Adhil Shetty said. The company expects to grow 80-90% in FY23, he added. Shetty said that the fintech firm achieved breakeven on a month-on-month basis in March 2022, and that they are currently not looking for immediate capital.

341.title: Pant honoured by Uttarakhand CM, months after being appointed state brand ambassador
341.article_body: Cricketer Rishabh Pant was on Thursday honoured by Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami in a programme organised at Uttarakhand Sadan in New Delhi, months after being appointed as the brand ambassador of the state. "It's no doubt a great feeling and also a huge responsibility," Pant wrote while sharing a picture on Instagram. Pant was born in Uttarakhand's Haridwar.

342.title: People chant 'chor-chor' as TMC leader Mondal is produced before court
342.article_body: Unidentified people chanted "chor-chor" (thief-thief) outside a CBI court in West Bengal's Asansol when Trinamool Congress (TMC) Birbhum district president Anubrata Mondal arrived there for a hearing on Thursday. People also showed black flags and shoes at his arrival. Mondal was arrested on Thursday in a cattle smuggling scam case. The CBI court has sent him to a 10-day custody.

343.title: Indian fintech startups to have $1 trillion assets by 2030: Report
343.article_body: Indian financial technology startups will have $1 trillion assets under management (AUM) and $200 billion revenue by 2030, a report by venture capital firm Chiratae Ventures and EY India said. The report added that fintechs' AUM in 2021 was around $100 billion and revenue around $20 billion. The digital lending market is expected to grow to $515 billion by 2030.

344.title: Tripura receives ₹50 cr to upgrade sports infrastructure in state
344.article_body: Tripura Sports Minister Sushanta Chowdhury announced that the state and central governments have sanctioned ₹50 crore to upgrade sports infrastructure in the state. "We want to develop sports infrastructure to ensure more good players come up. Also, sports will ensure youths don't take the path of drugs," he said. The government also decided to induct 100 new junior physical instructors.

345.title: Latvian Parliament declares Russia a 'state sponsor of terrorism'
345.article_body: The Latvian Parliament has declared Russia a “state sponsor of terrorism” for allegedly attacking civilians in its invasion of Ukraine. A strongly worded statement adopted by lawmakers in Riga said Moscow was using “suffering and intimidation as tools in its attempts to demoralise the Ukrainian people". In the 100-seat assembly, 67 lawmakers voted in favour of adopting the statement.

346.title: His condition has neither improved nor worsened: Raju Srivastava's daughter
346.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava continues to remain in the Intensive Care Unit of AIIMS after suffering from a heart attack. His daughter Antara, while sharing an update about his health, told Times of India, "His condition has neither improved nor worsened. The entire medical team is doing their best." "We are praying and hoping he will be fine soon," she added.

347.title: Speculation of my exit only strengthens my position: Bommai
347.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that speculations about his replacement will only strengthen his position. Calling the rumours politically motivated, Bommai said, "I have come to accept the situation. I know the truth. I know that there is no basis for this speculation." Bommai's remarks come amid Congress party's social media messages stating that the BJP will replace him.

348.title: Spain evacuates another 294 Afghan refugees
348.article_body: The Spanish government has evacuated another 294 refugees from Afghanistan to the country, via Pakistan, officials said on Thursday. Since August last year, Spain has evacuated to Madrid 3,900 people from the war-torn nation. The evacuated persons include people who had worked for the Spanish government or its troops stationed in Afghanistan before the Taliban took over.
