349.title: Do you think I have become old: Babar Azam to reporter asking if he should quit 1 format
349.article_body: After a reporter asked him if he should quit one format due to workload, Pakistan captain Babar Azam replied, "Do you think I have become old?" Babar added, "The kind of fitness that we have, I don't think we should limit ourselves to two formats." He further said, "If workload is high then we will increase our fitness levels."

350.title: MI Cape Town announce their first group of players for upcoming T20 league
350.article_body: MI Cape Town today announced the signing of five players ahead of the inaugural edition of Cricket South Africa T20 League. The players include Kagiso Rabada, Dewald Brevis, Rashid Khan, Sam Curran and Liam Livingstone. The players have been signed ahead of the auctions as per the rules that govern the T20 league, MI said.

351.title: Truck full of migrants overturns in North Macedonia; 35 injured
351.article_body: A truck carrying 49 Syrian migrants overturned on a road in North Macedonia, causing injuries to 35 people, police said on Thursday. The migrants are believed to have entered North Macedonia from neighbouring Greece. The truck driver escaped on foot from the accident scene on Wednesday and is suspected to be part of a migrant smuggling ring.

352.title: Was like hearing KK: Leslee Lewis on recording 'Yaaron' with KK's son
352.article_body: Music composer Leslee Lewis opened up on his experience of re-recording 'Yaaron Dosti' song with late singer KK's son Nakul and daughter Tamara. He said recording with Nakul was "unbelievable". "It was like I was hearing KK," he shared. The original version of the song, sung by KK, was recorded 23 years ago.

353.title: Shehbaz is very protective of me: Shehnaaz Gill
353.article_body: Bigg Boss 13 fame Shehnaaz Gill opened up about her relationship with brother Shehbaz. She said, "Shehbaz is very protective of me. Every brother-sister should be that for each other." Crediting Shehnaaz for his success, Shehbaz said he is 'very lucky' to have her in life. On the work front, Shehnaaz is set to make her Bollywood debut.

354.title: Congress MLA Sudip attacked in Tripura, hospitalised; party blames BJP
354.article_body: Congress MLA Sudip Roy Barman sustained head injuries on Thursday after being attacked by unidentified people during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Agartala, Tripura. He's undergoing treatment at hospital. Tripura Congress blamed "BJP goons" for the attack on Sudip and other leaders. Congress' Birajit Singh said miscreants had thrown stones at Sudip's car. Other Congress members were also injured.

355.title: Scriptures like Manusmriti give respectable position to women: HC Judge
355.article_body: Delhi High Court judge Justice Prathiba M Singh has said that the Indian women "are a blessed lot" since scriptures like Manusmriti give a very respectable position to them. She added that India is more progressive about women being in leadership roles. Women are respected in Asian countries because of the cultural and religious background of scriptures, she further said.

356.title: 160 grams of heroin seized in Haryana's Ambala, 2 arrested
356.article_body: The police on Thursday arrested two men, Arvind and Vijay, with 160 grams of heroin from a village near Ambala cantonment in Haryana, officials said. Acting on a tip off, a police team stopped a car at a check post on Ambala-Delhi highway, they added. During the search, police recovered the drugs from two men, both residents of Ambala Cantonment.

357.title: 'Dream Girl 2' to star Ananya, Paresh Rawal, Seema Pahwa: Reports
357.article_body: The makers of 'Dream Girl 2' have reportedly shortlisted the cast of the film. As per a report, Ananya Panday, Paresh Rawal and Seema Pahwa will be joining Ayushmann Khurrana, who will be reprising his role. 'Dream Girl 2' is the sequel of 2019 film with the same name. It was directed by Raaj Shaandilyaa.

358.title: Shashi Tharoor to be conferred France's highest civilian award
358.article_body: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor is set to be conferred with France's highest civilian award Chevalier de la Legion d'Honneur for his writings and speeches. French Ambassador to India Emmanuel Lenain wrote to Tharoor, informing him about the award. "I am honoured to be recognised in this way. My gratitude and appreciation," Tharoor said.

359.title: Dozens missing as migrant boat sinks off Greece's coast
359.article_body: A Greek navy vessel and three merchant ships were on a search and rescue operation on Thursday after a boat carrying migrants sank off the southeastern coast of Greece on Wednesday, officials said. Only 29 men from Afghanistan, Iran and Iraq have been rescued till now. Survivors told officials that 60 to 80 people were onboard the boat.

360.title: Cameroon troops killed 10 people in crackdown on separatists: NGO
360.article_body: Cameroonian troops "summarily killed" at least 10 people during President Paul Biya's crackdown on Anglophone separatists earlier in the year, a report by Human Rights Watch said on Thursday. "The troops also burned 12 homes, destroyed, and looted health facilities," the report stated. The report comes as fighting between security forces and militants have intensified recently.

361.title: Woman spends ₹48 lakh to look like Kim Kardashian in South Korea, pics surface
361.article_body: Cherrie Lee, 28, from South Korea has undergone 15 surgeries in eight years to look like Kim Kardashian. "Whenever I have to explain to someone that I'm Korean and they [say]...I don't look [like] it, I feel unique and exotic," she stated. She has spent £50,000 (over ₹48 lakh) on procedures including Brazilian butt lifts, breast augmentations and facial surgeries.

362.title: Centre waives off taxes for rich, but imposes it on poor: Kejriwal
362.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday attacked the Centre and said the Centre provides tax waivers for the rich, but overburdens the poor with taxes. "What was the condition of the central government that it was time to impose tax on the poorest of the poor?" Kejriwal questioned. Kejriwal further criticised the Centre's Agnipath scheme.

363.title: Nobody can force anyone to buy the national flag: Haryana CM
363.article_body: Amid reports that a Karnal ration depot compelled people to buy the tricolour, Haryana CM Manohar Khattar on Thursday clarified that nobody can force anyone to buy the flag. "No person will be denied...services even if he doesn't wish to buy the national flag. Under 'Har Ghar Tiranga Abhiyan', people can voluntarily buy the flag," CM said in a statement.

364.title: People took my self-confidence for arrogance: KGF actor Yash
364.article_body: Kannada actor Yash said his self-confidence made him what he is today. However, he said a few years ago, his self-confidence was mistaken for arrogance. "When I spoke with self-confidence like this a few years ago, some may have thought I was arrogant," he said. The 'KGF' star added that his belief in himself has brought respect to Kannada cinema.

365.title: 51-yr-old Norwegian woman staying illegally in India held in Manipur
365.article_body: A 51-year-old Norwegian woman has been arrested in the border town of Moreh in Manipur for illegally staying in India, the Assam Rifles said on Thursday. Mya Kyay Mon, who arrived in India in 2020, was intercepted at the foreigners' checkpost in Khudengthabi while she was travelling to Kolkata, it said. Her passport and visa had expired, it added.

366.title: He asked me to send girls to his bungalow every night: Hostel warden on MP SDM
366.article_body: A former warden of a government-run girls hostel in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district alleged that the then-district coordinator Bijender Singh Yadav, who's currently an SDM, used to ask her to "send girls to his bungalow" every night. She added he used to threaten her with transfer in case his demands weren't met. An inquiry has been launched into the matter.

367.title: Woman spends ₹48 lakh to look like Kim Kardashian, says 'People don't believe I'm Korean'
367.article_body: Cherrie Lee, 28, from South Korea has undergone 15 surgeries in eight years to look like Kim Kardashian. "Whenever I have to explain to someone that I'm Korean and they [say]...I don't look [like] it, I feel unique and exotic," she stated. She has spent £50,000 (over ₹48 lakh) on procedures including Brazilian butt lifts, breast augmentations and facial surgeries.

368.title: Kejriwal has given 'perverse twist' to freebies debate: Sitharaman
368.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday took a jibe at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, saying he had given a "perverse twist" to the debate on freebies as health and education were never considered giveaways. Sitharaman said that by classifying education and health as freebies, Kejriwal was trying to instil fear in the minds of the poor.

369.title: 4 killed, several missing as boat capsizes in UP's Banda due to strong winds
369.article_body: At least four people were killed and several went missing after a boat carrying around 35 people capsized in the Yamuna river in Uttar Pradesh's Banda. The boat capsized due to strong winds, the Superintendent of Police said. As per local residents, many of them were going to celebrate Raksha Bandhan with their siblings.

370.title: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict moves SC for premature release
370.article_body: Nalini Sriharan, a life convict in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, moved the Supreme Court on Thursday seeking premature release. She cited the court's judgement in the case where co-convict AG Perarivalan was released from prison. "Tamil Nadu [Council] had recommended [the] Governor to release the…convicts in 2018. But…the Governor sent the issue to the President," her lawyer said.

371.title: Self-driving Tesla Model 3 runs down child dummy in multiple safety tests
371.article_body: The Dawn Project CEO Dan O'Dowd has posted a video of a Tesla Model 3 equipped with Full Self-Driving (FSD) software running down a child mannequin placed in its path during safety tests. O'Dowd claimed there wasn't any interference or input from the test driver. He demanded a ban on FSD software until Tesla "proves it won't mow down children".

372.title: KL Rahul to lead India in 3-match ODI series against Zimbabwe, Dhawan named his deputy
372.article_body: Batter KL Rahul has been declared fit for the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe, the BCCI said. Rahul will be leading the squad in the series, while Shikhar Dhawan, who was initially named captain, has now been named Rahul's deputy. The ODI series will begin on August 18, while the last ODI will take place on August 22.

373.title: Armed man takes Beirut bank staff hostage, demands his trapped savings
373.article_body: A Lebanese man armed with a shotgun has taken hostages at a Beirut bank and threatened to set himself on fire unless he receives his trapped savings to pay his father's medical bills. Soldiers and police converged on the area and sought a negotiation. Lebanon's cash-strapped banks since 2019 have put strict limits on withdrawals of foreign currency assets.

374.title: In veiled attack at Nitish, Minister shares clip showing dog fighting 2 lions
374.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh, on Thursday, tweeted a video showing a dog trying to fight two lions and captioned it "Challenge 2024", which he later deleted. The video came a day after Bihar CM Nitish Kumar asserted that the NDA government needs to worry about the 2024 LS polls. "The RJD's plan to loot Bihar has begun," Singh said.

375.title: Pics of Kobe's remains after crash shared by police, firefighters for a laugh, court told
375.article_body: The pictures of Kobe Bryant's remains after the helicopter crash were shared by LA County police and firefighters "for a laugh", Kobe's wife Vanessa's attorney Luis Li told a court during Vanessa's invasion of privacy trial against the county. "They were shared by deputies playing video games...They were shared...with people who had absolutely no reason to receive them," he added.

376.title: TMC has become a party of thieves: WB Cong chief Adhir Chowdhury
376.article_body: After TMC's Anubrata Mondal was arrested by CBI in connection with the cattle smuggling scam, West Bengal Congress chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said TMC has become a party of thieves. "CM Mamata Banerjee and TMC leaders are involved in scams," Chowdhury said. "Such scams are not possible without the support of government and the police," he added.

377.title: 27-year-old American tourist raped in public toilet in Paris
377.article_body: An American woman was allegedly raped in a public toilet in Paris on Saturday. The 27-year-old was walking with her boyfriend along the River Seine across Notre Dame Cathedral when she stopped to use a public bathroom at around 1 am. The suspect, a 23-year-old man, was charged with rape and kept in custody.

378.title: Self-proclaimed politician Shrikant Tyagi's bail plea rejected
378.article_body: A court has rejected a bail plea filed by self-proclaimed politician Shrikant Tyagi, who is accused of molesting and abusing a woman in Noida. He was arrested from Meerut on Tuesday after absconding for days. Tyagi's lawyer Sushil Bhati said they will now approach the sessions court to contest this judgment.

379.title: US Justice dept to sue Google next month over ad market domination: Report
379.article_body: The US Department of Justice (DOJ) is preparing to sue Google as soon as next month over the firm's alleged illegal domination of the digital advertising market, Bloomberg reported. Lawyers of DOJ's antitrust division are reportedly questioning publishers in another round of interviews to refresh facts. DOJ's previous lawsuit against Google alleged that it dominates the online search market.

380.title: ED, CBI can set up offices at my residence if it brings peace: Tejashwi
380.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said he was far from being afraid of ED and CBI and was ready to let them set up offices at his residence if this brought peace. "If even this doesn't bring "shanti" (peace), I cannot help," Tejashwi said. He claimed he did not fear these agencies even during his first tenure as deputy CM.

381.title: 2 govt officials caught red-handed while accepting bribes in Assam
381.article_body: Police on Thursday said two government officials were caught red-handed while allegedly accepting bribes in Assam. Gopinath Das, working in the office of sub-registrar in Tamulpur, was caught while accepting bribe money, Anti-corruption and Vigilance director said. In the second incident, Lohit Phukan, working in the office of Inspector of Excise in Bokakhat, was apprehended with money, he added.

382.title: Suspected Maoists abduct, kill villager in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
382.article_body: Suspected Maoists abducted and killed a villager in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, police said on Thursday, adding the reason behind the murder was yet to be ascertained. Security personnel on Thursday recovered the body of the deceased villager, Gopiram Madkam, near his village Kahurgaon, a senior official said. Madkam was abducted from his village on August 8, the official added.

383.title: Man, wife kill 4 relatives over property in Howrah: Police
383.article_body: A man and his wife allegedly killed four of their family members over a property dispute in Howrah, West Bengal, police said on Thursday. While accused Debraj Ghosh is on the run, his wife Pallavi Ghosh was arrested. The accused allegedly stabbed Debraj's mother, his brother, sister-in-law and niece on Wednesday night, officials said.

384.title: Tyre of Coast Guard's Dornier aircraft bursts at Goa airport
384.article_body: A tyre of an Indian Coast Guard Dornier aircraft has burst during routine tests on a runway at the Dabolim airport in Goa, an official said. The incident delayed several flights operating from the airport since afternoon. The Coast Guard functions from the INS Hansa naval base, which is also home to the Dabolim civilian airport.

385.title: Will beat him, set venue on fire: BJP MLA on Munawar's Hyd show
385.article_body:
After stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui announced that he'll hold a show in Hyderabad,
BJP MLA T Raja Singh threatened to cancel the programme. In a video message, Singh said, "Wherever the programme is held, we shall beat him up...We shall set [the venue] on fire." He added, "We shall...teach him a lesson for abusing...Lord Ram if he comes to Telangana."

386.title: Influencer, who smoked inside flight, booked for drinking liquor in the middle of road
386.article_body: A case has been registered against social media influencer Bobby Kataria at Dehradun's Cantt police station for allegedly consuming liquor in the middle of a road in Uttarakhand. While sharing the video on Instagram, he had written, "It's time to enjoy on the roads." Earlier, a video of the influencer smoking inside a SpiceJet flight had gone viral.

387.title: Arjun Tendulkar to leave Mumbai, likely to play for Goa: Reports
387.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun Tendulkar will likely represent Goa in the upcoming domestic season, reports said. Arjun has applied for a No Objection Certificate from Mumbai Cricket Association. "Getting maximum game time...is important for him at this juncture of his career. We believe...the shift will improve...probability of him featuring in more competitive matches," SRT Sports Management said.

388.title: UP woman kills husband, buries body in house after quarrel: Police
388.article_body: A woman allegedly killed her husband and buried his body in their house after a quarrel in Uttar Pradesh's Khamaria on Sunday, police said. However, the woman told the police that her husband, Govind, hanged himself following the quarrel. She claimed that she got scared after Govind's death and dug a pit in their house and buried the body there.

389.title: No-confidence motion against Himachal govt defeated by voice vote
389.article_body: A no-confidence motion moved by Congress and CPI-M against the BJP government in Himachal Pradesh was defeated by a voice vote in the Assembly on Thursday. The Opposition MLAs walked out of the Assembly during Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur's reply. They criticised the government over several issues, including law and order, unemployment and price rise.

390.title: Salman Khan spends a day with Indian Navy sailors, pics surface
390.article_body: Actor Salman Khan on Thursday spent his day with sailors of the Indian Navy onboard INS Visakhapatnam. The pictures of the actor have gone viral on social media platforms. In the photos, he is seen interacting, working out and dancing with the sailors. Salman is currently shooting in Hyderabad for his upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'.

391.title: It hurts: Raqesh on hate against Ridhi after split with Shamita
391.article_body: Actor Raqesh Bapat said it 'hurts' to think about the hate his ex-wife Ridhi Dogra is receiving after his breakup with Shamita Shetty. Fans blamed Ridhi for Raqesh-Shamita's split. "She has been getting the crap from the audience for no reason. When there's no truth to the fact," he said. He added a third person can never break a relationship.

392.title: Gurugram makes background checks must for bouncers after guests beaten up outside club
392.article_body: Gurugram Police Commissioner Kala Ramachandran on Thursday made police verification and background checks mandatory for all the security staff working in bars and clubs. This comes a day after bouncers at a club beat up some men for opposing the alleged molestation of their female friend. Action will be taken against those agencies that don't get verification checks done.

393.title: 4 transport 30 kg of ganja from AP to Hyd, arrested
393.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested four persons of an inter-state gang and seized 30 kgs of ganja. The police arrested four of the seven-member gang and seized an auto and four mobile phones from them, all worth ₹9 lakh. One of the accused (Krishanaveni), has been peddling ganja for around four years, Rachakonda Police said.

394.title: Help us bring back body or get us visa: Brother of Indian woman who died by suicide in US
394.article_body: The family of Mandeep Kaur, who died by suicide in US allegedly over domestic abuse, is seeking help from government to enable them to either bring her body to India or arrange visa to perform last rites. However, as per the family, they haven't received any response from officials. "We...don't know what will happen with the body," said Mandeep's brother.

395.title: Four more held for attempting to kill TRS MLA in Hyderabad
395.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have arrested four more people for attempting to kill legislator, A Jeevan Reddy, of the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS). The four accused - Santosh, Suguna, Surender and Sagar - aided the main accused, Paddagani Prasad Goud, in executing his plan to kill the MLA. Prasad Goud, a TRS leader, was arrested by the police on August 8.

396.title: 7 kidnap friend who won ₹1 crore in online games in K'taka, arrested
396.article_body: Seven people were arrested in Karnataka for allegedly kidnapping their friend, who won over ₹1 crore in online games. The accused called the victim's father and demanded ₹1 crore as ransom, which the father refused to pay, reports said. However, the accused settled for ₹15 lakh and threatened to kill the victim if the ransom wasn't paid.

397.title: Punjab CM accepts resignation of VC who was asked by minister to lie down on dirty bed
397.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Singh Mann on Thursday accepted the resignation of Baba Farid University of Health Sciences, Faridkot, Vice-Chancellor Dr Raj Bahadur. He resigned on July 30, a day after Punjab Health Minister Chetan Singh Jauramajra forced him to lie down on a dirty bed at the university during an inspection. Dr Bahadur earlier said he felt humiliated.

398.title: Actor Vishal gets injured while shooting an action sequence: Reports
398.article_body: Actor Vishal got injured while shooting for an action sequence of his upcoming film 'Mark Antony'. As per the reports, the actor was rushed to a private hospital in Chennai. He has reportedly sustained a knee injury. The shoot of 'Mark Antony' is currently on hold. The actor will resume the shooting after his recovery.

399.title: Hyderabad on high alert ahead of Independence Day celebrations
399.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day celebrations, a high alert has been sounded in Hyderabad after reports from the Intelligence Bureau. Following the reports, security at temples, mosques, tourist places, bus and railway stations and other crowded places has been increased. To monitor the situation, additional security forces have also been deployed at hotels and other public places in the city.

400.title: Trial of German soldier who faces Russia spy charges begins
400.article_body: A German soldier Ralph G. who allegedly shared information with Russian intelligence services has been put on trial. Ralph G. has been accused of sharing excerpts from an official government document on Germany's relationship with Russia in the wake of annexation of Crimea in 2014. According to reports, information was shared via phone calls, email and messaging service WhatsApp.

401.title: Randeep Hooda remembers Sarabjit's sister Dalbir on Raksha Bandhan
401.article_body: Remembering Dalbir Kaur on Raksha Bandhan, Randeep Hooda penned a note in which he mentioned how he is realising the significance of her rakhi. He said he is sure that her blessings are always with him. Dalbir pronounced Randeep her brother after he played the role of her late brother Sarabjit Singh in the 2016 film 'Sarbjit'.
